During Fasting and in LCHF diets electrolytes are needed by the body . Hence its advisable to consume salt( preferably himalayan pink).

We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is * low fat vegan diet * . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is * Low Carb High Fat * One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet.

Apart from following either of the above diets many our members also fast for minimum 16 hours . This is called intermittent fasting and is clinically proven to reverse diabetes.

Would you be able to follow the above practices?

text: This is my personal Testimony. My name is Raj. I was diagnosed with T2 diabetes in March 2018 with A1c of 13 and fasting blood sugar of 375+. For the first 3 months I strictly followed LCHF along with intermittent fasting. Mostly one meal a day but fasted religiously fasted for 36, 48, 60 hours. The maximum fast was for 80 hours. My A1c dropped to 6.0 after 3 months and fasting blood sugar came down to below 100. I was never on any medication. I refused to take any medication. I then transitioned to LFV diet still practicing intermittent fasting and in the next 3 months dropped the A1c to 5.7. Since then my A1c has been below 5.7, my current A1c is 5.3.

messages.text: What exactly is intermittent fasting ? Does it mean fasting all time except breakfast,lunch and dinner time ?

messages.file: (File not included. Change data exporting settings to download.)
messages.thumbnail: (File not included. Change data exporting settings to download.)

messages.text: After 6-7 hours I feel a deep hunger n if I don't eat then I feel quit inner fever n weakness

Intermittent fasting means eating all your daily calories within a given eating window time. And fasting for rest of the time. For example you can have a 8 hours eating window from 9 am to 5 pm, you can eat during this window. From 5 pm to next day 9 am, you water fast!
It‚Äôs just a psychological feeling. Hunger pangs comes in waves, one must ignore them. Have some cold water with salt, or black coffee/black tea/ green tea.

Insulin Adjustment Guidelines as per NHS- DAFNE Course. 

A) They taught to put insulin when you eat carbs like bread,rice, chapati, pasta,cake. 

B) No insulin of fish, chicken,salads or any fat like butter, cheese.

C)  For Lentil/Dal half of the carbs put insulin  as we Indian eat more dal in quantity and not like a small bowl only .

D) I took a app Carbs and Cal its just 500INR and as per the weight of the food, I check carbs and put insulin.  

E) So per 10 gm 1 unit of insulin, though it also depends on your sugar levels like mine was little controlled , so 1:1 for some it was 1.50:1 or 2:1.

To check levels only fasting, pre-meals and before bed .

Should be below:

1. Morning fasting : between 70-120
2. Before each meal - 80-120
3. Before you sleep- 80-160 
4. Hypo only below 28 as per them even 35-40 is not hypo .

F) If your levels are more adjust extra 1 unit to increase and 1 less at lower range. ADJUSTMENT as per your levels.


Take aways: 

- My insulin reduced from fixed 14-14-14 total 42 units to only 6-10 units a day and now no carbs so no insulin.
- Course name was *Dosage adjustment for normal eating* it‚Äôs only done in Europe for type 1 which suggests to eat everything but they said some people start eating all and gain weight so choice is yours.
- Zero calories drinks can be taken.
- Eat anything and do carbs count be it cake. Drawback of this course is not guding towards healthy eating. But that is in on individual.
- And if you exercise like walk , swimming , gym then reduce basel insulin slowly by 10% each time but also depends on time of your exercise. 
- A person who attended the course there use to do 3 times swimming and only base insulin he use to put 3-4 and no quick action ,as before food sugar was in levels. 

We should eat still healthy like 2 bread for me is just 2 unit of insulin which was wow factor for me and all this made no hypo for me as earlier my levels went down till 20 also few times.
Thanks üôè
Specially after dinner my meal totally got diggested within 2-3 hours n I feel full stomach empty n hungry again.

Due to lock down doctors are not a available , my wife fasting sugar shows wrong 135 and pp 140, as she is in 6th month pregnant and diabetic, recently she facing problem of headache, and bloody vision, is it normal in pregnancy or what things need to check
She have 12 unit/3 meal insulin dose

1. You are hungry not because of food is digested. Hunger is not a function of the amount of food in your system. Its a function of your insulin response.

2. When you eat something the following change reaction happens. 
Step 1. BSL rises 
Step 2 Insulin rises to counter your BSL

3. Insulin triggers our hunger hormone Ghrelin

4. You are hungry.

So if you eat foods that don't trigger your BSL e.g. Low Fat Vegan Foods or Low Carb High-Fat foods OR your fast your BSL does not spike and you don't feel hungry.

We have many people here who routinely fast 48-72 hours. It‚Äôs not that our bodies are different. It‚Äôs because after 13-14 hours there is no insulin in our bodies and biologically no hunger can be present.

Congratulations on the pregnancy.

What is the reason for suspecting the fasting levels are incorrect

messages.text:
A lot of members fast. Low sugar or hypoglycemia is extremely rare in people with non insulin therapy 

Begin and if you feel hypo. Break your fast and measure sugar level
is that ur whattsapp number? may I contact u via whattsapp for a detailed LCHF plan

Phantom or PseudoHypoglycemia occurs when a person feels all the Hypoglycemia symptoms but the blood sugar is in the normal range. It happens because the body has always had a high sugar level and never experienced a normal blood sugar level and feels the normal sugar level is too low.

It's similar to when we have a history of overstuffing food and the day we eat a normal portion size meal we feel we have not eaten enough. 

It's psychological
yes thats what - whenever i feel shaky i test and I see that the sugar will be around 120-140
hope it can be reversed
We will have a online session soon where I cover these topics live for new joiners .
üëç
That is phantom hypoglycemia. The key is not to panic . It will go away and won‚Äôt reoccur
out of 2 diet which diet is in ease with stomach?

It depends. Some people have problems with carbohydrate intolerance from eating grains and starches like bloating and indigestion. For them LCHF is suitable 

For people who have lactose intolerance they maynot be able to consume dairy products. For them LFV is suitable 

In general vegetarians fare better in LFV and non vegetarians fare better in LCHF

text:
We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

They start fasting with a lot of skepticism but in 1-2 days discover its much easier than they think. After that, they get hooked to fasting. Fasting also greatly increases will power, concentration, and energy levels. A non faster will never achieve those levels.

messages.text:
Good afternoon Tim,  is this true ?
In the lab blood is drawn from vein while glucometer takes blood from capillary. Both are blood. But there is a huge difference. In the capillary, the blood is carrying glucose to the cells and in the vein, blood is going back to the heart AFTER depositing glucose in the cells. Therefore, there will always be a difference, the glucometer showing a higher value.
Any kinds of almonds can be consumed in LCHF diet
Ok thanks

All glucometers have a +/- 10 % error range. This is can be due to less blood is drawn than needed or also ineffective strips

I am not aware of the differences attributed to the reason mentioned in your post.

Some unforeseen issues with migration have come up. Postponing the launch to Sunday 7PM IST.

Did you know that sugar drains your body of key nutrients?

‚ÄãWhen you eat sugar, you set off a series of metabolic pathways that push the body to use more of its resources.

Firstly it was understood that sugar drains vitamin C out of your body.

Studies have found that excessive amounts of sugar, or glucose, in the body can inhibit the absorption of Vitamin C. In the 1970s, researchers established that sugar and Vitamin C have a similar structure and enter cells using the same GLUT receptors.

High glucose levels inhibit vitamin C from entering our cells, and decrease absorption rates. Researchers have found that reduced sugar intake may improve vitamin C levels as well as its benefits.

Vitamin D
‚Äã
‚ÄãThe metabolism of a type of sugar fructose, increases the production of an enzyme which breaks down stores of vitamin D. It can also undermine the production of another enzyme necessary to synthesize vitamin D. A shortage of Vitamin D can lead to a suppressed immune system and numerous health problems, including certain cancers. It's now estimated at least 75% of people in Western countries are deficient in vitamin D, consuming excess sugar alongside depleted vitamin D could explain why we experience such high rates of bone, teeth, and immune issues.

Magnesium

The high blood sugar and elevated insulin levels associated with excess sugar intake decrease magnesium absorption and cause the kidneys to excrete magnesium faster. Since magnesium is key in stabilizing blood sugar, a vicious cycle commences.
‚Äã
As blood sugar regulation is impaired even more magnesium is excreted. Cutting the sugar helps ensure that magnesium, critical for a plethora of bodily functions, is absorbed and maintained.

Chromium

Chromium, like magnesium, is involved in blood sugar regulation. Depletion of chromium contributes to decreased glucose tolerance, a precursor to diabetes. Like with magnesium and calcium, high sugar consumption promotes chromium excretion. Some data suggests consuming a diet consisting of 35% simple sugars increased natural excretion rates by 300%.

When you remove sugar from your diet, you feel your body recalibrating.

text: is LFV diet

messages.text:
A Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet focuses on whole plant foods, such as fruits, starchy vegetables like sweet potatoes, pulses, whole grains. vegetables, and eliminates animal foods like meats and dairy and eggs and processed foods, including refined oils, sugars, and grains. 

Fruits are the best thing one can eat on LFV diet. The spikes due to fruits comes down faster. The spikes from starches are much higher than fruits and takes longer to come down. Please don‚Äôt be scared. It‚Äôs very natural. 

Remember anything you eat on LFV diet will spike your blood sugar. I would encourage you to do the following:
1. For a month just check your fasting blood sugar
2. Eat fruits with some green, like spinach. Start with spinach.
3. Try to maintain at least 3 hours gap between each meal, no snacking.
4. Don‚Äôt eat after 6 pm. 
5. Go for a  brisk walk or do stair climbing one hour after each meal.

Perseverance and commitment is key to succeed on LFV because the spikes will really scare you. But if you are intimidated by the spikes just check your fasting sugar. It will take time for the body to readjust. LFV is a very slow process in terms of visible results, so please have patience.

messages.text: Good Morning
Fitbit or other device users what is your heart rate?

If you have higher Heart Rate you have greater cardiometabolic risk.

60-69 beats per minute (bpm), 2.08 times higher risk
70-79 bpm, 2.28 times higher risk
80-89 bpm, and 2.61 times higher risk

Elevated resting heart rate was positively associated with body mass index, systolic blood pressure, diastolic blood pressure, triglycerides, and fasting blood glucose levels

Several factors influence the resting heart rate. 

Genes play a role. The resting heart rate can increase with ageing too. 

Lowering the resting heart rate over time may be beneficial. Here are ways to lower your resting heart rate:

1. Exercise- The heart beats faster during and post exercise.  While you are exercising, you are actually training your heart to become stronger and more efficient at pumping blood. So when you are in rest mode, the heart is easily able to maintain a normal heartbeat. 

2. Practice stress reducing techniques- Performing meditation, breathing techniques, Tai chi and/or any other stress reducing techniques lowers the resting heart rate. 

3. Quit tobacco- Avoid tobacco and related products. Smokers have higher resting heart rate. But this elevated heart rate can be lowered once you quit. 

4. Weight loss- Being overweight puts stress on the heart to supply it with blood. Losing excessive weight helps to lower the resting heart rate. 

5. Eat healthy- Adding fish to the diet has been proven to lower the resting heart rate. If you don‚Äôt eat fish, you can consult your doctor for adding fish oil supplements to your regime.

didnt understand the question
18 hours fasting goes to 136 and 16 hours 150 types does time makes a difference ?
What is your Random blood sugar

The longer you fast the less glucose is produced from food. One of the two things will happen:
1. Sugar levels will drop in 2 digit levels and stay there.
2. The liver releases stored sugar to compensate for #1.

In your case, the body is still getting adjusted to its own natural cycle after stopping basal insulin. The stored sugar gets released and spikes for some time and then settle down. 

Here is something I would recommend. When your sugar spikes during a fast do the night meditation for 20 mins. This will subside the rising counter-regulatory hormones, sympathetic tone, noradrenaline, cortisol. 

It works like magic and the more you train your vagus nerve the more granular level control you have on your sugar levels. 

Training this during your fasting window is best because the spike is purely due to the parasympathetic response and there is no interference from food.

I would highly recommend using this window of a few weeks/months to train your vagus nerve in controlling insulin response.

*WHY MENTAL CONFUSION BEYOND 50 ???*

¬†Causes of: MENTAL CONFUSION IN THE THIRD AGE
By: Arnaldo Liechtenstein, physician.

Whenever I teach clinical medicine to students in the fourth year of medicine, I ask the following question:

What are the causes of mental confusion in the elderly?

Some offer: "Tumors in the head".  I answer: No!

Others suggest: "Early symptoms of Alzheimer's".  I answer again: No!

With each rejection of their answers, their responses dry up.

And they are even more open-mouthed when I list the three most common causes:

 - uncontrolled
   diabetes;
- urinary infection;
- dehydration

It may sound like a joke, but it isn't.  People over 50 constantly stop feeling thirsty and consequently stop drinking fluids.

When no one is around to remind them to drink fluids, they quickly dehydrate.  Dehydration is severe and affects the entire body.  It may cause abrupt mental confusion, a drop in blood pressure, increased heart palpitations,
angina (chest pain), coma and even death.

This habit of forgetting to drink fluids begins at age 50, when we have just over 50% of the water we should have in our bodies.  People over 50 have a lower water reserve. This is part of the natural aging process.

But there are more complications. Although they are dehydrated, they don't feel like drinking water, because their internal balance mechanisms don't work very well.

Conclusion:
People over 50 years old dehydrate easily, not only because they have a smaller water supply, but also because they do not feel the lack of water in the body.

Although people over 50 may look healthy, the performance of reactions and chemical functions can damage their entire body.

So here are two alerts:
¬† 1) *Get into the habit of drinking liquids*.  Liquids include water, juices, teas, coconut water, milk, soups,and water-rich fruits, such as watermelon, melon, peaches and pineapple;  Orange and tangerine also work. 

*The important thing is that, every two hours, you must drink some liquid.  Remember this!*

2) Alert for family members: constantly offer fluids to people over 50.  At the same time, observe them.

If you realize that they are rejecting liquids and, from one day to the next, they are irritable, breathless or display a lack of attention, these are almost certainly recurrent symptoms of dehydration.

¬†Arnaldo Liechtenstein (46), physician, is a general practitioner at Hospital das Cl√≠nicas and a collaborating professor in the Department of Clinical Medicine at the Faculty of Medicine of the University of S√£o Paulo (USP).

¬†Did you like it?

So spread it out!  DON'T FORGET TO DO IT NOW!

Your friends and family need to know for themselves and help you to be healthier and happier.

¬†It's good to share!¬† For people over 50

Dehydration is indeed a problem with seniors as is commonly observed with hospitalization cases.  This also leads to dizziness and confusion as is rightly mentioned in the post 

However consuming juices or milk is restricted in both of our diets as they can massively spike the sugar levels. This can be dangerous.

We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet.

Things you need to know before you turn to vegan diet-

1. Get a blood test done- Check HbA1c, vitamin B12, vitamin D, calcium, magnesium, ESR, CRP levels. Based on the results of the blood tests, you might need to start oral supplements or reconsider your dietary plan. 

2. Plan your protein intake for the day- Proteins are the building blocks for the body and should be part of every meal. Firstly, calculate your daily requirement depending on the level of your physical activity. Athletes require more protein. But for a normal individual with moderate physical activity you can calculate your daily protein requirement by using the following- (body weight in kgs) x 0.8 = daily protein requirement in gms 

3. What is your calorie expenditure- When you move to a vegan diet you eat plant based foods that are rich in fibre. Now fibre is not calorie dense. Although you tend to eat more quantity of these foods and feel fuller too, the calorie consumption comes down. So vegan diet is a great way to lose weight. But if you are not planning to lose weight, check your calorie expenditure for the day when you turn vegan. 

4. Digestive issues- A vegan diet can lead to irritation of the gut line in some people due to increased quantity of food intake. 

5. Satiety- People tend to digest vegan food faster because the ratio of protein in vegan food is lower when compared to a non-veg diet. As a result the food is digested faster and you might feel hungry and snack often. 

Remember the above tips when you plan to switch your diet. Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any further questions. 

Do repeat the above blood tests after 90 days. üå± 

- Dr Trupti Shirole
Why ESR and CRP both?

Elevated ESR is a non specific marker for inflammation. Elevated CRP is also a blood marker for inflammation. 

A vegan diet rich in antioxidant rich food like berries, carrots, tomatoes etc. can help fight inflammation and lower the oxidative stress. 

So you will notice improvement in these parameters over a period of time.

This is why a test that costs 300 in centralized lab costs 4-5x the amount in a local lab.

‚Äò‚Äò When a doctor (whether family doctor / general physician, consultant or surgeon) prescribes tests - pathology, radiology, X-rays, MRIs etc. - the laboratory conducting those tests gives commissions. messages.text: Any remedy for constipation?
Is it something chronic? Or an issue that you are facing lately?
‚ù§Ô∏è

Feeling constipated? 

I would strongly recommend that you should avoid taking laxatives as some of them are habit forming and can even weaken your intestines. Very often constipation is due to physical inactivity, improper diet, ageing or certain medications. Identify the root cause in your case and work on eliminating it. 

Following is the Ayurvedic approach to treat constipation. Try adopting these lifestyle changes and incorporating the home remedies listed below- 

Firstly, constipation occurs when there is Vata imbalance in the colon. The dry and cold properties of the Vata Dosha inhibits the proper function of the colon. This can be countered by adding warmth and hydration to the system. 

Let‚Äôs look at how we can achieve this-

1. Water- Drink plenty of warm/hot water. Avoid drinking water with your meals. You can have it 30 minutes before your meal or 60 minutes post meals. 

2. Oil- Add some amount of oil or dietary fat to your diet. Sesame oil and ghee are best to pacify the aggravated Vata Dosha. 

3. Fibre- Eat fruits that are rich in fibre such as apple. Ensure you don‚Äôt mix it up with any meal. Have your fruits at least an hour before or after a meal. Add leafy vegetables and salads to your diet. 

4. Home remedies- Try drinking a cup of warm milk with 2 tsp ghee or castor oil before bed time. 
Or
Boil 1 tbsp flaxseeds and some grated ginger in a cup of water for 2-3 mins. And drink this preparation before bed time. 
Or 
Have soaked black raisins/dried figs. (People with diabetes should avoid this.)

5. Exercise- Regular physical activity is important for having a clear bowel. Certain yoga postures like ‚Äòpavan muktasana‚Äô, ‚Äòuttana padasana‚Äô are helpful too. (Please try doing these postures under the guidance of a trained yoga practitioner.) 

6. Avoid- Avoid eating fried, frozen/cold or processed food. Limit the intake of beans, cabbage, cauliflower, broccoli, nuts and dry fruits. 

7. Ayurvedic medicines- Triphala tablets/powder, Gandharva haritaki churna/tablets, Psyllium husk, Aragwadharishtam, Trivrit lehyam and many more. 

Which medicine will help you and in what dose entirely depends on your body type, root cause and severity of the problem. 

But roughly, 2-3 tablets of Triphala or Eranda haritaki should help to clear the bowel. 
2 tbsp of Psyllium husk is sufficient for most people. Ensure you supplement it with plenty of water and warm milk. 

I would again emphasise that reduce/avoid your dependency on medications. Be proactive to adopt dietary and lifestyle changes.

For any further queries please feel free to drop a message here or get in touch with me. 

- Dr Trupti Shirole

You did the right thing. 

1. When possible get a fasting C-Peptide Test done. This will be a good indication of where you stand with Insulin Resistance(IR). Since you are 49 years old you are unlikely to have high IR.

2. Change your doctor. Go on 1MG

In general when does 16:8 start taking effects

It depends. Usually, in 1-2 days the sugar levels during fasting start subsiding. Your levels are good. The numbers are not influenced by your medicines as they have long left the bloodstream before you completed your 16hour fast.

In some cases, the sugar levels ride during fasting. This is stored glucose released by your liver as the body is running low on sugar. This is good and means fasting is working for you. The stores will eventually run out which is the whole purpose of fasting. 

Since you are following LCHF your stores will run out sooner than someone on LFV.

messages.text:
We all know that sugar is detrimental for our health. But how many of us check food labels to keep a tab on the sugar we might be ingesting indirectly? 

ALWAYS CHECK LABELS!

Sugar has so many names- sucrose, fructose, corn syrup, cane sugar etc. 

Here are some examples just to give you a rough idea-
‚Ä¢ 1 cup of instant oatmeal has 15 gm sugar
‚Ä¢ 2 tbsp of nut butter has 4 gm sugar
‚Ä¢ 2 tbsp of tomato ketchup has 8 gm sugar
‚Ä¢ 1/2 cup of pasta sauce has 9 gm sugar

(Please note that the actual values can vary depending on the brand)

Therefore, it is best to avoid processed / packaged food. Eat fresh and stay healthy! 

If you know of other such food products that might be a hidden source of sugar, please share it with all of us here. Looking forward to hear from you all ! üòä

- Dr Trupti Shirole

What's the science behind stored sugar in liver/pancreas/kidney

Its actually how many hours before waking up. Your body uses glucose (sugar) for energy and it is important to have enough extra energy to be able to wake up in the morning. So for a period of time in the early morning hours, usually between 3 a.m. and 8 a.m., your body starts churning out stored glucose to prepare for the upcoming day. When you fast there is no sugar being produced from food. Hence the liver is releasing the stored sugar. This a good thing. in an LCHF diet, you are following the stored sugar will eventually run out and the fasting numbers(130) will fall.

Egg yolk: to eat or not to?

Here are some nutritional details about chicken egg-

1. Egg shell- It is the best source of calcium carbonate for human consumption. It is commercially available in powder form- Kukut anda twak bhasma (Ayurvedic medicine). 

2. Egg white- It consists primarily of 88-99% water, 10% protein and some minerals. 

3. Egg yolk- It is a super food. Roughly it contains 48% water, 16% protein, 32-33% fat, vitamins and minerals. 

Given the above facts you can see that the egg yolk contains most of the egg‚Äôs good stuff. So don‚Äôt ditch the yolk. Eat your eggs whole! 

- Dr Trupti Shirole
Only if you are following LCHF diet
Absolutely!
yes for me..in LCHF ..THANKS.
üëç
Eggs are also a good source of choline

Choline deficiency causes muscle damage and abnormal deposition of fat in the liver, which results in a condition called nonalcoholic fatty liver disease. Genetic predispositions and gender can influence individual variation in choline requirements and thus the susceptibility to choline deficiency-induced fatty liver disease.
Yes. And choline plays an important role in metabolism and cellular growth. The body can make some amount of choline, but most of it comes from dietary sources- eggs, liver, peanuts.
üëç
Vegans can opt for spinach and beetroot
Cruciferous vegetables like broccoli are also good source

text: Good Morning Folks , time for our morning meditation.

messages.text: Good Morning Everyone
Good Morning
Good morning

Somebody asked me on WhatsApp if Diabetes Reversal is permanent and once reversed can they have anything they want .

The answer is no.

Nothing is permanent and relapse is always just a few missteps away.

A monk is only a few missteps away to lose all his powers and succumb to worldly pleasures. 

A programmer with 10yrs experience loses 30% of his knowledge if he doesn‚Äôt practice for a month and more than 80% if he doesn‚Äôt practice for a year .  

Olympic champions know that few days of loss or practice and they may not even make it to qualifications in the next tournament . 

Similarly if we don‚Äôt workout for a month we lose our health. 

If we don‚Äôt meditate for a week we lose most of the benefits .  

One has to relentlessly practice the fundamentals to prevent relapse . 

All of us have to relentlessly follow the  principles we discuss here to reverse diabetes . It‚Äôs not an event , a board exam. But a way of life . 

Accept that. Get on that path , detached from results.  Stay on that path , detached from results . 

This is the only way.
üëçIts just under remission and ready to strike back if given a chance

üëç

HbA1c is just an average blood sugar for about three months period. It doesn‚Äôt show the high and low during each day for a period of 90 days. It just gives half information. 
For instance HbA1c of 6 reflects the average blood sugar of 120 ( actually 126) for a period of 90 days.  This average can be obtained by any means irrespective of highs and lows. 
Let‚Äôs take two scenarios 
1. Fasting blood sugar 100 and PP 140, this will give an average of 120. Its good control.
2. Fasting blood sugar 80 and PP 160. The average is still 120 but 80 points spike is dangerous and must be avoided.

The actual cause is insulin resistance. One must focus to improve insulin sensitivity the rest will fall in place. 
You can‚Äôt treat pneumonia with just a fever reducer. You must take  antibiotics to treat it. The fever reducer will only give temporary relief from the fever not cure the pneumonia.
Unfortunately most diabetic treatments are focused on symptom control that is blood sugar

The relationship between A1c values and average blood sugar levels can also vary markedly from person to person. In studies using continuous glucose monitoring (CGM), 24/7 blood sugar levels can be compared to a measured A1c. These studies reveal considerable variation from person to person. For instance, an 8% A1c value in one person could reflect an average blood sugar of 140 mg/dl, while in another it could be 220 mg/dl. This variation relates to individual differences in how red blood cells and blood sugars bind or the lifespan of red blood cells.

Good Morning

I had received the following msg from one of our group members-

Doctor greetings ? I am told that having protein supplement powder helps to control hunger . Is it safe to have it in the night / may be instead of dinner or with little quantity of dinner ? Is this allowed in LCV diet ?

Protein shakes are highly processed and they can contain a lot of sugar.

Besides sugar, they contain other not so healthy ingredients, such as-

‚Ä¢ artificial sweeteners
‚Ä¢ refined oils
‚Ä¢ artificial colors and flavourings

In my opinion, it is best to avoid anything that is highly processed and contains ingredients that you do not recognise as food. 

A diet rich in protein and fibre will keep you full for longer and you will not have to resort to any shakes to curb hunger. 

Also, do not substitute any of your meals with protein or meal replacement shakes. There is no substitute to a well balanced wholesome meal. 

If you still decide to go ahead with protein shakes and you are following a LCV diet, then you will have to look for vegan protein shakes such as pea protein etc. 

But I would still insist that you ditch these artificial drinks and stay healthy with freshly cooked well balanced meals. 

I hope I have addressed all your questions. If you have any further queries, please feel free to write to me. Thank you!

- Dr Trupti Shirole
üëç! Also the total protein intake should not exceed 15-20% of the total daily calorie intake on any of the two diets we recommend.
Processed protein powder will also cause huge insulin spike just like processed carbs which is not an ideal situation for diabetics.
Finally I made it here üëç
Welcome to the group

We have LCHF and LFV diets here, not an LCV diet. If someone is following LCV diet as mentioned above( assuming its Low Carb Vegan Diet) then getting enough fat will be a huge challenge, though not impossible( from nuts and avocados)  

The high fat is critical to reversal. Without the body getting adapted to fat-burning, reversal will not work. At max, he may be able to control his diabetes for some time but sooner rather than later in order not to go calorie deficit and control hunger pangs he will resort to a high protein diet of lentils (and supplements) which will increase his protein consumption and still lead to insulin spike( albeit slower) via gluconeogenesis.

An LCHF diet is poorly understood by people and medical professionals globally as a high protein diet and associated gout and kidney problems are the reason the LCHF diet has earned a bad rep.

From reading the question I have a feeling the person has not understood the LCHF diet and is trying a Low Carb High Protein Vegan diet. That should be the first place to educate & course correct him.

Anyone who has understood LFV and LCHF diets will never have questions about protein supplements. LCHF has non-veg and LFV has lentils which are more than enough for the sub 20% requirement.
Certainly there is over obsession with protein. You correctly stated that most people incorrectly assume LCHF diet to be a high protein diet, which causes all the problems.

Yes, Supplements are a big industry, 

Begins with Complan & pediasure for children and ends with Ensure for old age people with horlicks and protinex somewhere in between.

We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet.

Any indicator that the 16 hour fast is working, when does the fast start taking effects, in general diabetes reversal and IRessistance takes 3-4 months  for fat layers of your internal organs to burn off, people can give testimony of self, who have reversed it, so we could get motivated

It also depends on other factors like 

1. Pancreatic ( beta cell) Function
2. Fatty liver ( stored sugar)

If 1 is good and 2 is negative In most cases 3 months means a drop of 3 points of A1C .
If you have been diabetic for 10 years and having medications for that long, do you think it has effected the pancreas beta cells

To some extent yes. The extent will depend on how healthy the pancreas are , degree of insulin resistance. Diet and genetics . 

Diabetes is not a progressive disease. Someone can have more damage in 10 months compared to someone in 10yrs . We have seen many people who have gone from HbA1C in 5.x levels to 10+ in less than a year . 

Similarly the reversal is not linear. Hence we ask people to commit to the process and not get attached to the results.

It‚Äôs similar to weight loss where people get frustrated with results and give up only when there were right around the corner for a steady reduction .  If they committed to the process without getting obsessed with day to day results they would have got them.

Question to ask..How long should we take this diet..I mean do we have any time limit..?

On average we see 1 point HbA1C reduction per month. So it will depend on your current hbA1C how long you need to stick to the diet. For most people it's 3-6 months.

However, even after reversal you may switch from one diet to another (LFV<>LCHF) but not merge the diets. This will cause a relapse. Having said that after you have reversed your diabetes you may make small deviations from time to time.

There is no dependence. We call it a way of life. 

Once you get accustomed to following them you will not want to go back to old eating habits nor will you miss anything. In most cases, your body will reject all junk food.

what is this ketone..any guide lines..send me the link..can me get this m/c imported from your country..cost in INR.
Mr.Raj (Admin) can you help me with diet chart?

Blood ketones are a measure of how efficiently your body is burning fat. You will have to follow a Ketogenic Diet(extreme form of LCHF) or do an extended fast(48+ hours) to achieve that. 

Diabetes is a problem of excess glucose. When a cell is full of glucose..it cannot have any more glucose enter it..and the excess glucose is spilled into the bloodstream. Once you stop eating the stored glucose is emptied and that is what provides energy to the body until that too empties. At that point there is no glucose in the body for it to produce energy. This is where Ketosis kicks in and body fat is converted to energy. You then have transitioned from a glucose burning state to fat burning state.

Ketosis is measured by amount of ketones in our blood stream and that is what the meter reading is. 

The meter and strips are available in the US and if someone is traveling you can ask to carry it for you.

My food choices are very narrow. I can spend my whole life eating mangoes, bananas, rice, dal and potatoes.

Dairy has always come and gone in phases of my life. I grew up drinking the purest form of milk coming from neighbors cow. Folks taking insulin. due to reduced physical activity during COVID, chances are you might not be needing the prescribed dosage of insulin. A higher than needed dose can cause hypoglycemia. Having said that it might also be the opposite and your sugar levels spike due to decreased activity and your insulin dosage might need to be increased.

Without knowing the pre meal numbers, it‚Äôs difficult to arrive at a conclusion. There are many factors affecting the blood sugar apart from the food you eat. The liver is continuously releasing sugar in the blood to maintain the blood sugar. This process is highly unregulated in diabetes
Yes you can eat bananas on LFV diet. Remember no oil, no nuts

LFV is a slow process of diabetes reversal. Unlike LCHF diet wherein the carbs are totally avoided, LFV is high carb diet. Carbs will naturally spike the blood sugar. The key thing is how soon this spikes comes down to normal levels

messages.text:
Rice (Whole grains) can be consumed in Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet and not allowed in LCHF diet.

We ask LFV members to measure their 1hr PP sugar level after consuming grains. if you observe very high spikes(>200) please refrain from consuming grains in the early phases of diabetes reversal.

Its not a zero fat diet. Its a low fat diet. We recommend restricting the fat to less than 5% of the total daily calories.
Exactly!
Got the point üëçüëç

This also helps in minimizing the insulin spike. A mixture of carb and fat spikes higher amount of insulin. Diabetes at the root level is disease of hyperinsulin. This approach also helps in lowering insulin levels and thus improving the insulin resistance

But insulin is required to break down the glucose right and if I'm not mistaken it's that the insulin produced is unable to break the glucose from the food due to the fat surrounding the pancreas. This is what I understood from Tim's video in fb which I saw recently. I'm not very well versed with theory. Please dont mistake me.

Insulin does not break down the glucose. The carbohydrates we eat is broken down to glucose during digestion and then absorbed into the blood to be transported to different part of the body to be used as energy. Insulin like a key which opens the cells door so that glucose from the blood can be moved into the cell. In diabetes the cell do not respond to insulin, that is why the blood sugar keeps on increasing.

The cells don't respond to insulin because of the storage of fat in the muscles, liver, and pancreas. Muscles, liver and pancreas are not suppose to store fat. There are special type of cell designed to store fat called Adipose tissue.

messages.text: LCHF is a general way of eating that involves consuming foods that are generally low-carb and high-fat. The ketogenic diet is a form of LCHF diet and a metabolic state that switches your body from burning glucose as fuel to burning fat as fuel. Both diets are clinically proven to reverse diabetes, hypertension, help loose fat and improve heart health.

It‚Äôs very easy to go overboard with any types of nuts. Though groundnut/peanuts are technically legumes and not nuts, they are relatively high in carbs. We repeatedly advice people to keep track of their macros. On LCHF diet, total carbs consumed in a day should not exceed 50 g. Preferably below 20 g.

text:
Folks,
Today is a Sunday and every Sunday I will request all of you to invite at least one person into our network. 

It is said that the best way to help yourself is to help others. 
The best way to reduce your suffering is to reduce that of others. 
The best way to heal is to help others heal.

The people who have benefited the most from our group are also the ones that relentlessly helped others to the point that it seemed personal. 

I have received many calls from people in this group who wanted to help someone in an emergency like hypoglycemia or a sudden spike in blood sugar. Then there are many who have added 40-50 people to this group often from their apartment or old friends network. 

God has been extremely kind to them in blessing them with good health and it seems that he has taken onto the task of healing them personally. Once you are into that zone, almost nothing can touch you.

I would request all of you to align your mission of eradicating diabetes from your body to eradicating diabetes from the world. Help yourself by helping others.

It's extremely easy , just share this link and ask them to download Telegram and join

In appreciation for your efforts, we will gift 25 Glucometer strips to the top two winners of who refers the most # of people. 

Regards,Tim

text: there any alternative to milk in LFV diet?

messages.text:
A Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet focuses on whole plant foods, such as fruits, starchy vegetables like sweet potatoes, pulses, whole grains. vegetables, and eliminates animal foods like meats and dairy and eggs and processed foods, including refined oils, sugars, and grains. 

Fruits are the best thing one can eat on LFV diet. The spikes due to fruits comes down faster. The spikes from starches are much higher than fruits and takes longer to come down. Please don‚Äôt be scared. It‚Äôs very natural. 

Remember anything you eat on LFV diet will spike your blood sugar. I would encourage you to do the following:
1. For a month just check your fasting blood sugar
2. Eat fruits with some green, like spinach. Start with spinach.
3. Try to maintain at least 3 hours gap between each meal, no snacking.
4. Don‚Äôt eat after 6 pm. 
5. Go for a  brisk walk or do stair climbing one hour after each meal.

Perseverance and commitment is key to succeed on LFV because the spikes will really scare you. But if you are intimidated by the spikes just check your fasting sugar. It will take time for the body to readjust. LFV is a very slow process in terms of visible results, so please have patience.

My recipe one of my Tamil friend taught me this years back:

1) 1 glass rice soak over night

4) mix well keep aside 90% covered with plate for 7-8 hours to ferment and then make idli or dosa

Despite the lockdown and the curfews and other impediments to movement, we should try and achieve at least 10,000 steps on a given regular, 'not-too-manic' day!

Although 10,000 steps per day sound like a lot, these many steps can easily be achieved just by 'staying on your feet‚Äô, all day long!

NEAT (Non-Exercise Activity Thermogenesis) is the most modifiable component of your TDEE (Total Daily Energy Expenditure). 

By now we all understand that a calorie-deficit nutrition and raised physical activity (through raised NEAT) is the surest way to lose weight / fat / inches and to keep weight off too.

So set your daily target for the number of steps you would be taking (I suggest 5,000 or 6,000 to begin with) and take it up from there. 

A little more elaboration about NEAT:

Of all the components of human daily energy expenditure (BMR, thermic energy of food, exercise-related activity thermogenesis (EAT) and NEAT), NEAT is the most modifiable parameter. 

NEAT includes energy expenditure of walking, talking, going for your job, sitting, toe-tapping, shopping, dancing, etc.

Therefore, stop being a couch potato and get going.üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 

- Dr Trupti Shirole

messages.text: fully active..

I didn‚Äôt follow your question? With your weight and height we can calculate your BMI. 

But BMI isn‚Äôt always the right/only parameter that you should focus on. 

It is often misleading. 

The weight might have dropped but your fat % might still be high. 

It‚Äôs better to get a complete analysis done.

Insulin and C-Peptide are two different hormones. usually, high C Peptide is also correlated with high Insulin levels. But in cases of Insulin Resistance, Insulin is not released in the bloodstream as it's blocked by the fat cells. However, C peptide has no issues in coming to the bloodstream.

Hence a healthy C peptide means your pancreas is producing enough insulin, its not just getting released to bloodstream. Treat the insulin resistance and both numbers improve. 

The above is an over-simplistic explanation of things. The science behind it is more complicated
Thanks Tim for removing my doubt

text.text:
We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

You have 8 hours of eating window with a minimum of 3 hours gap between each meal.

So if you start your eating window at 8.30 am, you should finish your last meal by 4.30 pm.

From 4.30 on to next day 8.30 am, you are fasting. No food allowed during this period

The next meal can be at 12 noon and let‚Äôs say you finish the meal by 12.30 pm.

The next meal would be after 3 hours, at  3.30 or 4 .00 pm. Finish your last meal by 4.30 pm.
3 hours gap between each meal and no snacks, tea or coffee

messages.text:

Astrovastin 80mg
Ok. Please share lipid results when you have them
Statins are almost never required when fasting and elevate sugar levels.

The two most common medicines given to people with Diabetes are statins( Ecosprin AV) and any blood pressure medicines. Both raise blood sugar levels. If you are taking any of them then you will not see much reduction in HbA1C.

I am not having satin since 6 months but started now since 2 days as cholesterol high as per doctor though still waiting for the report.
yes, having aspirin since 2006
Ok. Your BP medicines will also interfere with blood sugar levels.

Fasting and LFV, LCHF diets we discuss here reduce all metabolic disorders like BP, Diabetes, Lipids, Thyroid. So you can expect a reduction in each one of them. If you are a fasting watch for HypoTension. BP levels go down and the meds further reduce them taking them to very low levels. Hence you may be experiencing dizziness.

Yes , I do post meals though 18-19 fasting I don‚Äôt feel dizziness .
post dinner when I take medicines and sometimes post first meal also tolerable dizziness
Do you have a BP meter? It can be postprandial hypotension.
Yes, I do check 2-3 times a week

Are you vegetarian?

We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

Query : For LFV low GI fruits can we eat cherries üçí
All fruits are allowed on LFV

Cherries have among the lowest glycemic index and glycemic load values of all fruit. The glycemic index for cherries is 22, and the glycemic load is three. The glycemic index measures the effect that a carbohydrate-containing food has on blood sugar levels. A score of zero to 55 is considered low.
Thanks. As I prefer eating only berries and apple sometimes
You can also have strawberries, blueberries, blackberry along with Apple, and Cherries
What is intermittent fasting

Intermittent fasting (IF) is an eating pattern that cycles between periods of fasting and eating. We recommends members to fast for a minimum 16 hours and eat all their meals in the 8 hours of eating window. During the fasting period only water, black coffee, black tea, green tea (without sugar and sweetener)

2 hour PPBG is mostly to test efficacy of medications. 1 hour PPBG is more reflective of your insulin response to meals and lifestyle modifications . Hence please measure 1hr PPBG.

I would suggest measuring your FBG at 4AM, 7AM and 10AM for 1 day without ANY medication.

What we are trying to determine is how much role Dawn Phenomenon has on your FBG. 4AM & 7AM will reveal you true numbers and will be a good baseline to make appropriate changes.

Sleeping at 1AM will raise FBG for even people with no diabetes. I don't have (pre)diabetes for many years and still had FBG in 110s when I used to sleep late. We are going completely against circadian rhythm and it is bound to affect metabolic process.

text:
Folks,
Today is a Sunday and every Sunday I will request all of you to invite at least one person into our network. 

It is said that the best way to help yourself is to help others. 
The best way to reduce your suffering is to reduce that of others. 
The best way to heal is to help others heal.

The people who have benefited the most from our group are also the ones that relentlessly helped others to the point that it seemed personal. 

I have received many calls from people in this group who wanted to help someone in an emergency like hypoglycemia or a sudden spike in blood sugar. Then there are many who have added 40-50 people to this group often from their apartment or old friends network. 

God has been extremely kind to them in blessing them with good health and it seems that he has taken onto the task of healing them personally. Once you are into that zone, almost nothing can touch you.

I would request all of you to align your mission of eradicating diabetes from your body to eradicating diabetes from the world. Help yourself by helping others.

It's extremely easy , just share this link and ask them to download Telegram and join

In appreciation for your efforts, we will gift 25 Glucometer strips to the top two winners of who refers the most # of people. 

Regards,Tim

text.text:
We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

messages.text: Apart from the diet, we also recommend a minimum of 16 hours fasting on daily basis. Intermittent fasting is one of the major pillar in reversing T2 diabetes

It‚Äôs very easy. You don‚Äôt have to just jump into a 16 hours fast. Follow these simple method to ease into it!

1. Start with your dinner. Have the dinner one hour before your regular time and eat your breakfast one hour later than usual. You have added two hours to your already existing fasting schedule. 
Do this for one week.

2. Next week, follow the same method above and add another 2 hours to the fasting schedule.

Slowly you will be fasting for 16-18 hours without any difficulty

messages.text: Is Intermittent fasting means time between dinner and next morning breakfast?

And what if we fall asleep?

Yes . Start from breath in . 

Elongate your breathes . Try to breath in longer . Hold Longer and breath out longer. 

Since this meditation lowers the resting heart rate ( RHR) feeling drowsy and falling asleep is very common . Hence it was initially designed to be a sleep meditation with long music to take you deeper into sleep . 

Although a lot of people now use the 7am IST meditation to help them sleep.

messages.text: My Bp is this fine ?

Following should be the macros ratio on LCHF 

Fat-75-80% (Of Total Calories)
Protein-15-20%
Carb-less than 5%

If you‚Äôre consuming high protein and less fat, the body will convert the excess protein into sugar and raise your blood sugar.

Majority of people follow this diet incorrectly, and consume high protein and moderate fat.
One must not consume 0.6 g of protein per kg of the body weight. So if you weigh 100 kg, the total amount of protein allowed in a day is 60 g which is equal to 240 calories.

   Fat 24 g

Total Calories-
Fat-34 g x 9 = 306 
Protein-12 x 4 = 48
Carbs- 1.2 x 4 = 4.8

Total Calories-358.8
Fat% 85.28
Protein% 13.37
Carb% 1.34

You don‚Äôt have to calculate everything manually! There are so many apps which does this calculation for you!

Yesterday dad had roasted moong dal made in no oil, tomatoes, and Onion only. Sugar spiked 70Points. When he has raw sprouts of the 3 times quantity of the same moong dal( green) his sugar spikes only 10 points.

Query : when we say 50gm carb in LCHF why can‚Äôt a person eat potatoes or some direct carb ?
Because 100gms of potato has 20 gms of carbs . You won‚Äôt be able to have any other carbs like veggies etc.
Imagine we are allowed to spend only 100 rs a day. Will we spend it all on one item?
Moreover hardly any one is meticulous to actually calculate how many grams of carbs they are consuming. There are hidden carbs which we seldom notice or think about, for instance eggs!
üëç
Yes. Eggs have carbs and Chapatis have protein are hard to imagine
100 g of onion has 10 g of carbs and people on LCHF used it very liberally
üëç
A chapati has 4gm of protein , so 4 chapatis have 16gms, but people still think they are protein deficient
Onions are hence not allowed in keto

Protein is most abused macro on LCHF diet. One should not exceed 0.6-0.7 g per kg of the body weight. So if you‚Äôre are on heavier side and weigh 100 kg, the max daily allowance is 70 g which is equal 280 calories. I wonder how many of us measuring these minute details, which makes a lot of difference in the final result.

Excess protein is another cause for insulin resistance and we all blame carbs!

The fitness industry will push for minimum 1-1.5gm per kg of body weight . I have gained strength and muscle on less than 30gms. The whole 1gm per body weight is a myth . 

Even when I was in school have seen people put on muscle and strength eating just a small bowl of black chana . That‚Äôs all they could afford.
Certainly there is over obsession about protein!

Ok. Then would suggest adding intermittent fasting . Our members who have reversed their diabetes fast 16 hours minimum . In that duration you can only have water , green tea and black coffee . People usually have early dinner and late breakfast, or some skip breakfast completely . 

Is that something you can do?

Soo thanks Tim ,,saw ur video on intermittent fasting on FB
Just need to ask about frequency 
I mean is it daily or alternative days?

The analogy I give to people about rising sugar levels during fasting is this.  

Imagine defrosting a ice-laden freezer that is full of ice in every corner. In the beginning, only small pieces of ice will melt. But as times goes large chunks of ice start falling out. The same thing happens with stored sugar. In the first few weeks, the fasting BSL gradually creeps up. And then suddenly you will see sugar levels in 160s-180s. I have even seen 200s. This means the liver is dumping massive amounts of stored sugar into the bloodstream. In absence of replenishment like in an LCHF diet the stored sugar levels deplete out really quickly and in the end, the sugar level stabilizes

Whenever you see massive levels of blood sugar when you are fasting 16+ hours , be happy about it. The clogged stores of sugar are emptying, the fat in the liver is also dissolving .Its hip hip hurray time .

The other thing that is working in your favour is the night meditation . 

Regulating your Vagus Nerve is an extremely powerful way to control fasting sugar levels . At that time neither food nor medicines are present in the body . Dawn phenomenon or high fasting blood sugar level is completely a psychological problem that can be prevented by stimulating the vagus nerve .
Most people do it daily . It becomes a habit very soon and very easy to maintain .
Oh Tim,,starting on three time weekly then progress to daily
Yes, I don‚Äôt miss that at all.
Sure! Keep us posted

You now control the most powerful nerve.

You are no longer a human . 

You are a superhuman
Sir can you give more info on the vagus nerve mediation?
When n how do we need to follow it
The 10pm IST meditation post by Deepa
This one.
Ok
Just need to play it and meditate?
Before sleep

Some of our members have high fasting sugar level even though they have reduced their PP levels.

Some others fast 16+ hours and still see high sugar levels in the initial weeks of fasting 


Here is something we recommend. When your sugar spikes during a fast do the night meditation for 20 mins. 

This will subside the rising counter-regulatory hormones , increased sympathetic tone, noradrenaline, cortisol...all hormones that increase the fasting sugar level 

It works like magic and the more you train your vagus nerve using this meditation the more granular level control you have on your sugar levels . 

Training this during your fasting window is best because the spike is purely due to parasympathetic response and there is no interference from food.

You should see results in daily practice of 2 weeks
Yes. Follow the instructions

Since last 10 Days, 
I have been getting FBS around 140-150 in the morning 8 am. 

But just before first meal at around 1pm after 16 hours fasting, FBS comes down to 80-90 .

However in the evening at around 6pm, sugar reading comes 70-100 I.e. random.

I am on LFV diet and strictly following only fruits veg and salad.

It seems liver is releasing the sugar in the morning .

Pls suggest and also let us know after how many months, morning FBS come down to the range of 70-90

This will depend on how much sugar is stored in the liver 

High sugar levels during IF are a good sign 

You may incorporate the night meditation in your daily practice as that would be the most effective way of reducing your fasting sugar levels

messages.text: Fresh yummy Salad to break the fast!üòã My only meal for the day and I‚Äôm on my way to next 24 hours of fasting!
The salad is high in fat (Mayonnaise and Olive oil used as dressing), very low in protein and carbs. A perfect example of Low Carb and High Fat.

LCHF is not about eating tons of non-veg in each meal. In fact the non-veg has to be consumed moderately to keep the protein in moderation. Fortify each meal with  higher fat content relative to the protein and carb. If you are not getting the desired result on LCHF diet, please revisit your diet once again and increase your fat and decrease your protein and carbs. Absolutely no grains like rice, brown rice, roti or any fruits on LCHF diet.

We can have Mayonnise also ? 

I am not eating non veg daily . Today I had Greek yogurt buttermilk in morning , afternoon cream and little berries and evening baigan fried . Is it fine ? 

My levels today fasting -110 and now post dinner 4 hours -100

Yes you can have Mayonnaise but be diligent to check the ingredients, absolutely no sugar.

Again check for the amount of sugar/carbs per serving of the Greek Yogurt. I would preferably have a high fat Greek Yogurt.

You numbers are awesome and they speak a volume about the food choices you made. üëç
Yummy

text:
Folks,
Today is a Sunday and every Sunday I will request all of you to invite at least one person into our network. 

It is said that the best way to help yourself is to help others. 
The best way to reduce your suffering is to reduce that of others. 
The best way to heal is to help others heal.

The people who have benefited the most from our group are also the ones that relentlessly helped others to the point that it seemed personal. 

I have received many calls from people in this group who wanted to help someone in an emergency like hypoglycemia or a sudden spike in blood sugar. Then there are many who have added 40-50 people to this group often from their apartment or old friends network. 

God has been extremely kind to them in blessing them with good health and it seems that he has taken onto the task of healing them personally. Once you are into that zone, almost nothing can touch you.

I would request all of you to align your mission of eradicating diabetes from your body to eradicating diabetes from the world. Help yourself by helping others.

It's extremely easy , just share this link and ask them to download Telegram and join

In appreciation for your efforts, we will gift 25 Glucometer strips to the top two winners of who refers the most # of people. 

Regards,Tim

We don't recommend any grains in the first few months of reversal and especially processed food like atta( including Jowar Bajra etc.). We only recommend eating whole foods like vegetables and fruits.

Taking insulin will make the body further insulin resistant and you are signaling the pancreas that it need not produce insulin as you are meeting the requirements from outside.

For example - As when I do carb calculations on the app it says 20 carbs so I put 2 units approx

20 gms from complex carb sources like nuts and berries don‚Äôt need 2 units of insulin.

20gms from simple carb sources like chapati needs some insulin ( 2 is a little too much)

The type of carb matters a lot. Slow acting carb or fast acting carb . 

You can test the same by consuming 20gms of walnuts and see if it spikes . From what I know , it won‚Äôt

The difference is night and day.

Now 2 more people added. So 6 people are sleeping on the floor. Some benefits they have reported.

1. Less anxiety about the future. They have realized how little we need to lead happy lives. The sleep quality has gone up and they wake up less anxious about the future. Every night sleeping on the floor reinforces this thought that our unhealthy attachment to possessions is what drives us into anxiety. You can be happier with no possessions. Possessions =Anxiety.

2. No back pain: People sleep on yoga mats and some on plastic Straw mats. 

3. AC not needed. This feedback is from some hot cities like Mumbai and Kolkata. The coolness emanating from the floor is enough to feel comfortable. Plus mattresses get hot in summers. Personally, for me, my room fan is not working and I didn't need it even during the hottest days in Bangalore. Now it's cold.

One friend recently shifted from PG to her own residence. She did not buy a single piece of furniture, no bed, no mattress, no chair, no table.  She said after sleeping on the floor for 4 months she doesn't need any furniture. 

I particularly like point 1. I never saw it like that and slept on floor because it was hot on the mattress. But looking back I think the reinforcement of how little we need also played in my subconscious. I have very little attachment left to anything material.

Being detached from materialistic possessions and work has counterintuitively increased there presence in my life. Things chase you when you stop chasing them. However, at that point, they have very little meaning left for you.

This is something that has been emphasized in almost all religious guides from Gita to Quoran to Buddhist scriptures. Work detached, and the results will come. However, what appeared to me as a very Nihilist way of life has become the path to move forward

The reason I am sharing this with all of you is the path to Diabetes Reversal is marred with ups and downs. Some days you will see amazing sugar levels and you would want to share it with the world. Some days the numbers will go up, and you will feel let down. It's very important to not get affected by these ups and downs. Don't develop a liking to good numbers and aversion to bad numbers. You will become miserable and never be able to come out of that cycle. Know there will be good days and then there will be bad days and then detach from them and stay focussed on the process. 

If you are committed to either of the diets we follow here, eat whole foods, fast regularly, maintain good sleep hours your results are bound to come. You don't need any fancy spices, supplements, tips, tricks, etc to reverse your diabetes. I see over and over again people lose what benefits they gained ( Diabetes reversal, Fat Loss, Mood betterment) because they were too attached to results and as soon as they lose motivation ( internal or external) they fall off the path. Don't be that person.

Personally having a higher goal, a life's mission helped. The body and mind are mere gifts to serve a large purpose in this world. Life is very short and only when we commit every living moment to the betterment of the world, anxiety disappears, happiness increases, health returns.

Meditating, eating healthy, exercising, waking up before dawn, none of this needs any motivation. They all come automatically to us because now we are driven by a higher purpose in life. The purpose keeps everything glued together and at some point, you will realize you are not part of the universe but the universe is part of you.

messages.text: Hi Everyone does sugar range increase after walk ?
Plz reply

The increase in blood sugar levels after exercise demonstrates the insulin resistance. 
When you start exercise the body is anticipating the use of blood sugar as energy, it is expecting a demand. In order to maintain the optimum blood sugar levels the liver then releases sugar into the blood but due to the insulin resistance, this additional sugar is not efficiently moved away from the blood. Hence the increase in blood sugar.

This is exactly like early morning Dawn Phenomenon, wherein the liver makes and  releases additional sugar into the blood, anticipating that the body will need additional energy to get up and perform work. 
But this causes blood sugar spike as the body is not able to use this energy efficiently due to Insulin resistance.
Thanks but it is normal or harmful

It‚Äôs very natural process. 

1. The liver continuously releases sugar in the blood to maintain an optimum level of blood sugar.  It‚Äôs the sugar factory working 24x 7. 

2. The sugar from the blood is then used by the body as energy with the help of insulin. Blood is the transportation system to deliver the sugar to the destination to be used as energy. 

3. Insulin is the key which removes the sugar from the blood to be used as energy. 
This key doesn‚Äôt work properly in diabetics and hence the sugar moves out very slowly from the blood. The traffic is not regulated properly creating a traffic jam. Hence diabetics see a high blood sugar.

4. The entire process runs on a demand and supply. If the body senses their is going to be high demand for the energy, then it sends a signal to the liver to release more sugar.


5. But as the sugar is not able to reach its destination properly because the insulin is not working, the blood sugar keeps on increasing.

6. This is very natural process. Irrespective you are eating or not, the body is continuously making sugar and releasing into the blood.
Superb way to make understand in very simple words.Very phenomenal Raj sir. In my point of view my MD doctor also would not make me understood like you make to the group.üôèüôè
üôè

Liver is like our Mom and Wife, working round the clock in the kitchen making breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. The supply keeps on coming, irrespective we are eating or not. If we eat, the food is consumed and if we don‚Äôt there is tons of leftovers in the kitchen or fridge. 
The only difference is that we can throw out the excess leftover food into the trash or give to someone. Hence keeping our house neat and clean. 
There is no such system for the body.  Though it does try to eliminate the excess sugar via urine. The excess energy ‚ÄúSugar‚Äù keeps accumulating in the blood, resulting in diabetes.
If you go out for a jogging or exercise or come back from work. Mother or wife they anticipate that you will need energy hence they are always ready with some snack and tea to re charge you. That‚Äôs our Liver! üòú
Nice explanation

text.text:
It‚Äôs very natural process. 

1. The liver continuously releases sugar in the blood to maintain an optimum level of blood sugar.  It‚Äôs the sugar factory working 24x 7. 

2. The sugar from the blood is then used by the body as energy with the help of insulin. Blood is the transportation system to deliver the sugar to the destination to be used as energy. 

3. Insulin is the key which removes the sugar from the blood to be used as energy. 
This key doesn‚Äôt work properly in diabetics and hence the sugar moves out very slowly from the blood. The traffic is not regulated properly creating a traffic jam. Hence diabetics see a high blood sugar.

4. The entire process runs on a demand and supply. If the body senses their is going to be high demand for the energy, then it sends a signal to the liver to release more sugar.


5. But as the sugar is not able to reach its destination properly because the insulin is not working, the blood sugar keeps on increasing.

6. This is very natural process. Irrespective you are eating or not, the body is continuously making sugar and releasing into the blood.

messages.text: Thank you sir

text.text:
The increase in blood sugar levels after exercise demonstrates the insulin resistance. 
When you start exercise the body is anticipating the use of blood sugar as energy, it is expecting a demand. In order to maintain the optimum blood sugar levels the liver then releases sugar into the blood but due to the insulin resistance, this additional sugar is not efficiently moved away from the blood. Hence the increase in blood sugar.

messages.text: So what do you want to suggest me regarding my exercise?

text.text:
This is exactly like early morning Dawn Phenomenon, wherein the liver makes and  releases additional sugar into the blood, anticipating that the body will need additional energy to get up and perform work. 
But this causes blood sugar spike as the body is not able to use this energy efficiently due to Insulin resistance.

In what way will it be useful?

LCHF advice . 

The cornerstone of the LCHF diet is the body changes from ' Glucose Burning' to 'Fat Burning' state. To effect this there are only two ways.

1. Feed the body more fat and deprive it of carbs( glucose production) & protein( to prevent glucose production from protein via Gluconeogenesis). Hence the 70% fat 20% protein and 10% carb advice . When no carbs or protein are eaten the body cannot manufacture glucose and is forced to produce ketones that convert fat to energy. This process takes from a few weeks to sometimes 2 months and is called Ketosis. Once this process has started the body has become fat adapted and burns fat instead of glucose for energy

2. Deprive the body of all food. Carbs, Fats, Protein. In the absence of all energy sources, the body starts burning its own fat reserves. This is achieved via Intermittent fasting. 

LCHF+ IF is a winning combination as both force the body to burn fat instead of glucose.

The only way to measure if you are in ketosis is to measure your blood ketones( ketone meter) or urine ketones ( urine ketones) .

1. HbA1c doesn‚Äôt tell you whether you are a diabetic or non diabetic.

I would recommend the following test to confirm diabetes or pre diabetes

1.  Fasting C-Peptide

2. Fasting Insulin 

3. Fasting blood sugar

4. One hour insulin response to a high carb meal

5. HbA1c 

6. Liver panel test

7. Lipid profile (ALT, AST, GGT included) This may be covered under Comprehensive Metabolic Panel Test but I‚Äôm not sure about India.

8. Comprehensive Metabolic Panel

9. HS CRP

10. TSH + Free T4

11. Vitamin D, 25-OH

12. Vitamin B 12

13. Check your BMI

14. Check your waist to height ratio. ( Important market for Insulin Resistance)

15. MRI scan for visceral fat level
 
Most Indians fall under the category of TOFI, Thin from Outside and Fat from Inside.
can add if I‚Äôm missing any other test.

messages.text: Do you snore

Why is waist-height ratio important?
The waist to height ratio is a measure of the distribution of body fat. Higher values of waist-height ratio indicate a higher risk of obesity-related cardiovascular diseases since it is correlated with abdominal obesity. Studies have found that waist-height ratio is a good indicator of the risk of heart attack, stroke or death, and insulin resistance. Other indicators of abdominal obesity are body mass index (BMI) and waist-hip ratio. Based on the waist to height ratio, you can allocate yourself to one of these groups:

Extremely slim - <0.34 both for men and women
Healthy - 0.43 to 0.52 for men and 0.42 to 0.48 for women
Overweight - 0.53 to 0.57 for men and 0.49 to 0.53 for women
Very overweight - 0.58 to 0.62 for men and 0.54 to 0.57 for women
Morbidly obese - >0.63 for men and >0.58 for women

messages.text: Good Morning everyone..Happy Gurupoornima to our Gurus Tim Sir and Raj Sir.  I am at present with my ailing mom, goin back home on Tuesday to Mumbai.  I have not been following any specific diet here except for 16-18 hours of IF and 24 hours fast on Tuesday.  My doubt is when I reach home I have to be under 14 days home quarantine, can I follow IF and start LCHF..as I have been told that during Quarantine one has to take good diet and and not skip meals as it will affect  immunity.  I am worried about the health of my husband who is border line diabetic and a senior citizen.  He is also on IF now.  Please advice whether I can follow IF and start LCHF or wait till my Quarantine perior is over.

IF increases immunity . So dont worry, carry on with that practice. 

And yes you can do LCHF as well, This will keep your sugar levels low and decrease any complications. The issue is will you have access to all the food that is needed to follow LCHF successfully?

Yes.  I will try to get someone stock my fridge with the required food items.  Thank u so much Tim Sir..I am so used to IF and happy with the reduction in my hypothyroid and HbA1c levels that I don't want to stop it.  Thank u once again..üôè

text:
Folks,
Today is a Sunday and every Sunday I will request all of you to invite at least one person into our network. 

It is said that the best way to help yourself is to help others. 
The best way to reduce your suffering is to reduce that of others. 
The best way to heal is to help others heal.

The people who have benefited the most from our group are also the ones that relentlessly helped others to the point that it seemed personal. 

I have received many calls from people in this group who wanted to help someone in an emergency like hypoglycemia or a sudden spike in blood sugar. Then there are many who have added 40-50 people to this group often from their apartment or old friends network. 

God has been extremely kind to them in blessing them with good health and it seems that he has taken onto the task of healing them personally. Once you are into that zone, almost nothing can touch you.

I would request all of you to align your mission of eradicating diabetes from your body to eradicating diabetes from the world. Help yourself by helping others.

It's extremely easy , just share this link and ask them to download Telegram and join

In appreciation for your efforts, we will gift 25 Glucometer strips to the top two winners of who refers the most # of people. 

Regards,Tim

messages.text:
These are not light dinners, rather heavy dinners due to their highly processed carb content. 

What we classify as light dinner would be raw or medium cooked Veggies, especially in salad form and soups. 

Carbs especially processed ones like rice, sooji will spike your blood sugar and in turn insulin which in turn your cortisol and bound to disrupt sleep.

Digestion of food takes 4 hours and even if you try to sleep it will keep you awake. 

My sleep quality did not go up until i started eating atleast 4 hours before bedtime. Now I eat at 4PM and sleep by 8:30-9PM.  Its called eating as per circadian rhythm ( internal body clock. I also stop drinking water post 6pm as bathroom visits disrupt sleep. 

If I were you I would make the following two changes.

1. Eat light dinner before sunset 
2. Try to sleep earlier than 9:30PM. If you have babies this is difficult. 
3. Get up from bed when you wake up in the morning. You will stary waking up super early , dont go back to sleep. This is the one of the biggest mistakes people do. When you wake up first time in the morning that is your body natural cycle. People disrepect it by going back to sleep and get punished with sleepy tired , groggy days. Try it one day and see the difference.

For depression
For depression begin with the morning and evening IST meditations we do here daily. If that does not help see a psychotherapist. You can hire someone for online consults from India for pretty cheap.

May know the details of diets in detail
We recommend 2 types of diet
Low Carb High Fat and Low Fat Vegan

We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?
