A note about Healthifyme. You may download their app to track macros( which is not that hard without an app) 

But dont follow their diabetes diet plans. They follow a 'hybrid diet ‚Äò approach and it doesn't work for reversing diabetes. One might get short term control but it wont reverse your diabetes. 

Also portion control is not something we stress here, we just ask people to eat till satiety, not over eat. Just protein needs to be <20% which if you have 1 bowl per day should be enough . If you practice intermittent fasting you will mostly be calorie deficient and there is no need to track calories.

Get in tune with your body, it will send you clear signals of what works for you.
Dont use a GPS in the journey of life, you will never learn the streets well.

@Raj:how much percentage you will give between IF and Diet in revering the diabetes.
Both are equally important!
IF helps in lowering the insulin which is critical to reverse insulin sensitivity and diabetes. A proper diet should be able to spike less insulin!

For instance during a 18 hour of fast the body brings down the insulin to say 5, and if one goes an eat regular food spiking the insulin levels through roof, say 60 plus. The body will have restart the work of lowering the insulin again during the next IF period. It‚Äôs like undoing everything achieved during IF
The idea of IF and a proper diet is to keep the insulin insulin levels lower!
Means more insulin more sugar and more fat deposited in the cells.

Insulin is a fat storing hormone. In presence of high insulin body goes into a energy storage mode. Everything is stored as fat. That‚Äôs why people with high levels of insulin will always feel hungry because body is in the energy storage mode!

How to burn this stubborn visceral fat

1. Reduce your total carbs intake to less than 20 g! 

2. Go for extended fast of 3 x 36 or 3 x 42 hours per week! 

3. Change the fasting and feeding schedule to trick the body. Don‚Äôt let it guess when the food is going to come.

4. Try to finish the last meal of the day by 1-2 pm

5. Sound sleep is also key to keep the stress hormone low! 

I‚Äôm also working on my visceral fat loss. That is why I have extended my fasting hours to 48-72 hours!
I‚Äôm planning to strictly follow this for an year! I am not going to look at the scale but the inches I am losing along my waist line!

4 days fasting.

would recommend the following test to confirm diabetes or pre diabetes

1.  Fasting C-Peptide

2. Fasting Insulin 

3. Fasting blood sugar

4. One hour insulin response to a high carb meal

5. HbA1c 

6. Liver panel test

7. Lipid profile (ALT, AST, GGT included) This may be covered under Comprehensive Metabolic Panel Test but I‚Äôm not sure about India.

8. Comprehensive Metabolic Panel

9. HS CRP

10. TSH + Free T4

11. Vitamin D, 25-OH

12. Vitamin B 12

13. Check your BMI

messages.text:
It‚Äôs a tricky question. There are so many criterion to be satisfied before I would say that diabetes is reversed. Two important criteria apart from HbA1c, Fasting blood sugar, 1 hour and 2 hour PP are BMI and waist to height ratio.

If you‚Äôre just looking at the HbA1c, fasting blood sugar and you feel that still they are not in normal range, then you might extend your fast. 

We all are different individuals and react differently to every thing.

2 years since my diagnosis, I am still in a process of reversal as I am yet to have the desired BMI and Waist to Height ratio. Though all other parameters are perfect.

Having said that from blood sugar perspective, I was very vigorous in my approach. For six months it was just one meal a day and a minimum of 23 hours fast. I also had extended fast of 36, 48, 72 and 90 hours! This helped me lower my A1c from 13.0 to 5.5 and fasting blood sugar from 385+ to 90‚Äôs in 6 months!
OK

1. What you are experiencing is called Ketotic Hypoglycemia , though you are not in that BS level yet. It should stabilize. 

2. Since Ketones are at work why do you worry about glucose?
Since you are in a controlled fasting environment Ketotit Hypo should not be a concern. Keep checking your sugar levels at regular intervals.

If it stabilizes at this level, that is between 60-70, I have no worries.

But I would be concerned if it drops below 60!
I monitor every four hours
üëç
I have never seen blood sugar below 70 after 24 hours of fasting!
It‚Äôs due to the prolonged  ketosis
Yeap!

What is the role of ketosis ? 

What could be the healthy range of ketosis for everyone? 

How to maintain the ketosis level in the body?

Ketosis is state where the body is burning fat as energy instead of sugar. This mostly happens when the insulin level is low. A low insulin level facilitates the fat to released from fat cells to be used as energy. The nutritional ketosis starts at 0.5. Intermittent fasting of more than 18 hours, or extended fasting or a LCHF diet will keep the body in a constant state of ketosis.

hi Raj... Good Morning all... I m doing well with intermittent fasting.. 10 days.. it is amazing feeling..   extended from 14 to 16 and  18 now. one basic Q.. can tender coconut water b taken to break fast. have a wonderful day
secondly.. is it ok to have diluted fresh Amla juice  or lime  water during fasting.. no sweetener no salt

During an extended fast body' goes in a state of low insulin, so one must not break the fast with something that will suddenly spike the blood sugar. The body must be slowly tuned into the feeding state. 100 mL of coconut water has about 7 g of sugar, which may suddenly spike the blood sugar. Hence we recommend to break the fast with either protein, fat or a salad.

Hooray! Broccoli can be consumed in both Low Fat Vegan diet & Low Carb High Fat diet.  On a Low Carb High Fat diet you can have all vegetables except root Vegetables that grow under the ground. These are restricted: Yams, beets, parsnips, turnips, rutabagas, carrots, yuca, kohlrabi, celery root, horseradish, daikon, jicama, radishes. Pumpkin and Squash are also restricted
Onion, Garlic ,Turmeric, Ginger are used as spices and to be used in limited quantities

text.text: Effect of Eating According to Circadian Cycle

text:
:
I did an experiment on myself over the past three months to see the how does eating according to circadian cycle affects me! The scientist in me always love to experiment and validate the facts.
I did the following change:
My last meal of the day used to be between 1-2 pm. I moved it to between 6-7 pm.
The rest everything remained same. I was still following LFV diet, walking and working out every day. Fasting on a daily for a minimum of 18 hours! Absolutely no change apart from changing my meal timings!
My A1c changed from 5.3 to 5.7 and of course I did put on some weight!

Eating and sleeping as per circadian rhythm has made the quality of my life atleast 20x better . And I didn‚Äôt have to do anything other than eat early and sleep early. Nature did everything for me

text: You are bound to see the blood sugar spike during the transition, that is for sure. The body will take time to adapt to the carb and sugar load. For transition I would do the following

text.text:
1. Slowly eliminate the fat in your diet

2. Stop using oil, ghee, butter etc

3. Then try to go for an extended fast

4. Introduce salads and boiled vegetables for about a week 

5. Then slowly introduce low glycemic fruits along with green leafy vegetables!

text:
Personally, I feel it‚Äôs too early for you to transition to LFV. I would only think of transitioning after maintaining a HbA1c of less than 5.5 for an year! 

With 6.1, you are still in the reversal phase.

I would advice not to rush!

messages.text: Type 2 Diabetes is basically a state of "Energy Toxicity". The body is in a state of excess energy and it is not able to use the energy properly. This happens because of high insulin levels. The idea of reversal is to make the body to efficiently use one fuel either sugar or carbs efficiently by maintaining the insulin level low.
üëç
Thanks tim sir and raj sir. Watched the video. It is new for me. Fatty pancreas.
üôè

Fatty Pancreas and Fatty Liver happens because of the over spill of fat in the body. The regular fat cells are overfilled because of a high insulin state and body starts storing fat around organs, and in muscles. This is the state of "Energy Toxicity"
Means we have two hindrances. 1 fatty pancrease and body cell resistance to insuline.
If we achieve 1st goal then how to increase body sensitivity.
Not only fatty pancreas but also fatty liver, and most of the body cells including muscle and fat cells being resistant to Insulin
Every thing in the body works like a symphony in harmony. If you fix one thing it will fix so many other things. Automatically taken care off. Body is very smart.
it's very interesting and complex

All these days i was imagining an aged person based on your advise for diabetes.  For the first time i was astonished to see so young person with so much of knowledge in a chosen field.  I can only imagine as to what level of knowledge you would be possessing as days pass by.  Great

messages.text:
Pork can be consumed in Low Carb High Fat(LCHF) diet and not allowed in Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet.

We ask our members to restrict protein to <20% of your total calorie requirements.. Excess protein may get converted into sugar by liver by a process called gluconeogenesis.

messages.text: I am in UK - London
You mean a Continuous Glucose Meter?

For the last 50 yrs a lot of press has been written about non invasive glucometers...By non invasive glucometers companies themselves. 

It‚Äôs best to wait till any such company passes clinical trials and reliability tests for multiple years before using them. Most of them come , scam the market and disappear. A lot of them claim they have FDA approval but they don‚Äôt. 

The best way to stop pricking multiple times is to keep blood sugar at bay

messages.text:
Tim m so thankful to u all
Theoritical i always knew things
But u people made me believe thru practical exapmles
üôèüèª Hear everyone! Believe no one until you have seen the results.
Hi Raj, how long you are planned to do IF ? Your glucose reading is good, are you waiting for the reversing diabetic ?

This is my lifestyle now! I have been doing it since March 2018. I don‚Äôt think I am ever going to stop the IF or the extended fast! 
There are still many parameters, which I need to achieve before I can say I have reversed my diabetes. I still have a long way to go.
Blood sugar doesn‚Äôt define the reversal of diabetes.
I still prick and check a minimum of 6 times per day. This is a Good Practice and Discipline I have learned.
Is there any age restrictions for doing IF, thought to recommending to my parents and relatives.
I checked with my friend who is using Dexcom G6. He mentioned it  takes some time to calibrate.
And it works great.
Please research yourself before buying...
You will have to go past the pain until the pain disappear. Until then you have to keep pricking however painful it is
When I was diagnosed in 2016 I pricked 7-8 times a day. often randomly stopping on highways to test my 1 hr PP. I had lots of pain in the beginning but i soon got over it

I have doing it religiously for over 2 years now! I use the side of the fingers. I rotate the fingers. 
I have never experienced any pain or soreness! 
Even if it pains, I am happy to bear these pains rather than experiencing diabetic complications later.
I just can‚Äôt live in ignorance and denial.
After diagnosis in 2018, I was testing like crazy. I used to check it every one hour till I went to bed! Still between 6-10 per day!
I don‚Äôt use it.

When I started meditating in the 10 day Vipassana retreat for 14 hours a day the pain was unbearable the first few hours. Then it subsided. The physical pain stopped in 4 days but the mental pain became unbearable. Then the mental pain also stopped on the 10th day. All the while I focussed on the pain to meditate . The pain went away and the meditation improved.

When the fan went out in my room in summer, I was under a lot of discomfort. I used to sleep meditating on every single trickle of sweat arising from the body. Slowly the sweat stopped and the sleep quality improved. Now I sleep much better without any fan. I also sleep on the floor.
üëçNo pain no gain!
Pain is just an imaginative state, Focus intensely on it and it will disappear like a frightened mouse , never to appear again.

messages.text: Irrespective of age anybody can fast for 12-14 hours. Just requires a little planning! Have an early dinner and late breakfast!

Also, now I only eat when I‚Äôm genuinely hungry. I have stopped eating for pleasure and entertainment!

‚ù§Ô∏è
The best way to build mental toughness is practice Intermittent Fasting and Meditation. You will start knowing the real you and not the artificial you the world has made you to believe.
Exactly! Intermittent fasting has made me realize how little we need to eat to thrive!
Sometimes I just have a cup of tea with cream after an extended fast and go without eating for another 36-48 hours! It‚Äôs so amazing!

Intermittent fasting has made me believe how little we need in our lives to stay happy and healthy. 

Meditation has made me believe how little the world has to offer us and how all the treasures of the world are inside us. 

Sleeping on the floor has made me believe how unhealthy our possessions are and how getting rid of them leads to ultimate peace.

The only thing that can bring ultimate peace and joy is having a goal of serving humanity. I encourage everyone to just try the above things for 1 week. I can bet it will change your life.

messages.text:
Awesome!!! Many people think its a waste of time. I too was one of them just about 1yr ago. There is no way i would be able to get up at 2:30AM daily and pulling straight 18 hour days without meditation. 

The only thing I am still deeply attached to are my parents. Thats the only place where I get majorly upset. However I will get over it soon. Attachments are unhealthy and come in the way of my duties.
Thank you Tim sir and Raj sir for such a wonderful and much needed insight with excellent explanation and example üôèüôè
üôèüèª

I‚Äôm still learning so many things from Tim! 
I‚Äôm so fortunate that he spotted me in the crowd and made a part of this noble cause.
It has give a new meaning to my life! 
Thanks Timüôèüôèüôè

Pick a mission larger than your own needs. 

Fear not. Its a sin

Attach not. Its suffering

You will come out victorious. 

God will himself plan with you how you want your life , what you want in life and when you want to end your life and how you want it to end. He himself will come to lead you to heaven.
üôèüèª And I have learnt so many things from you
üôèüôèüôè
üôè
Very true parents and kids are the two main in life where we get majorly upset

I have been a strong proponent of ‚ÄúNo Expectations‚Äù and people always ask me how can I have no expectations from any one. 
I never ask my kids or wife even to serve me a glass of water!

Yes. especially mother to the child and child to the mother . Attachment means there will be good moments when I will want to spend every moment at her feet and bad moments when I will be upset and not want to speak to her. These come in the way of my duties that a son has towards his mother. The duties should not be impacted, hence the attachment must go. Its going to be very hard but I will get over it.
Very true!
Same sir my husband is also same I ask sometimes whether when we grow up our kids will take care of us the answer I get don't expect anything just do ur duty religiously

Thats the best way to live.

Give everything you can in service of others. Give willingly because if you hold it back the universe will painfully snatch it from you . It will extract every ounce from you and you will then complain that life is not fair. Rather going that pain, give happily and then the universe will return a thousand fold back to you.
It makes a lot of sense. I realized this very early in my life, expectations are the root cause of most of our sufferings and unhappiness!

A saint hood life which a common man cannot achieve easily.  With your strong determination you have come up to this stage. Though i got attached to this group for eradicating diabetes now our goal have been set for enlightenment in life.  Its doing at first B.A. then M.A. then M.phil and then a doctorate
üôèüôè
Exactly! Do the service without any expectations!
These are not philosophical theories. You can start practicing them right away. Start and you will see results within few days.
üôèüôèüôè
It cannot be achieved easily if you hold back. Open the floodgates, start giving, start helping others. Have not fear or doubt. The universe will do its magic. Trust it and do your part
üëç
We cannot eradicate diabetes by treating diabetes alone. We have to eradicate things at the root , the attachment to food and lifestyle of excess. every single misery will vanish.
‚ù§Ô∏è

text.text:
We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

Good Evening Tim

My recipe for creamy CHICKEN EGG SOUP üòÅ
Ingredients
Onion 1/2 : Finely chopped
Garlic2-3cloves: Grated
Ginger: Equal quantity as grated garlic
Black Pepper: 4-5 pieces
Ghee&butter:1 full TeaSpoon Each
Cream: 2 table spoon(I use Amul Cream)
Soyasouce & Vinegar : 1 tablespoon each
Carrot 1/2: Grated 
Spinach 4 leaves: Finely chopped
Chicken 100gms: Boiled & smashed
Eggs2: whole eggs

Preparation : 
1. Use the same chicken water/ stew (around 3-4 bowls of stew) with which the chicken was boiled...keep boiling it in medium flame, add the boiled&smashed chicken in it
2. Fry grated onion for 2-3 mins in any pan and any cooking oil add carrots in it and fry for 2-3 mins and then add spinach and fry for another 2-3 mins
3. Add the fried items into the boiling chicken stew along with the grated ginger and garlic
4. Add salt, ghee, butter to the boiling mixture
5. Crack the eggs on the boiling mixture and keep stirring so that egg white and egg yolk gets mixed in the boiling stew and add soya sauce & vinegar. Keep stirring and boiling for another 5 mins
6. Serve in a bowl, add cream, season with black pepper on top and enjoy it with your loved ones üòÑ

messages.text:
Corn (Whole grains) can be consumed in Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet and not allowed in LCHF diet.

We ask LFV members to measure their 1hr PP sugar level after consuming grains. if you observe very high spikes(>200) please refrain from consuming grains in the early phases of diabetes reversal.
Dear Tim and Raj, for how long do we need to be in lchf or lfv diets before we see a change in sugar level and weight,
How often can we switch between two diets
Also while I try to follow the diet and also trying the fasting at times finding myself giving into craving like yesterday had aloo paratha and a bowl of brown rice

On an LCHF diet typically the PP sugar levels become normal in 1-2 weeks and fasting levels in 2 months. 

On LFV diet PP sugar levels become normal in 4-6 weeks and fasting levels in 3- 4 months. 

With Intermittent fasting added to the above the same results are seen in half the time.

Remember, these are controlled numbers. To achieve true insulin resistance reversal it takes 6 months or longer in either of these diets.
You need to stick to either of the diets for at-least 6 months .

Are you drinking atleast 3 liters of water in the morning until you break your fast?

Often what we think as hunger is dehydration.

There can be no real hunger in the body after 12-13 hour mark as their is no insulin in the body.

One of the best times to meditate is when you are in pain. 

Focus on the pain . Feel every little bit of it. 

It‚Äôs much easier compared to a stable mind .  Try it for yourself and you will notice the pain disappeared after focussing on it for few days

These are called as gross sensations and used to train new meditators to meditate and old meditators to calm the mind for deeper meditation.

A question someone asked me ‚Äú Is Fasting sugar dependent on diet? ‚Äú

My answer is 


In short term It depends less on food and more on hormones.  

I‚Äôm long term both food and hormones 

The easiest way to regulate fasting in short term is meditation. 

Exercise also helps in both short term and long term
I have a basic doubt.. is taking water with salt during fasting ok for someone with hypertension?. wont it increase water retention and therefore bp
The salt you are taking is to replenish the loss of electrolytes during fasting .  So in net you are not adding extra salt to your diet .

A comparison you can draw is people take salt water after Diarrhea. This is because there is rapid loss of salt from the body which needs to be restored. You are not adding extra salt to the ody..just restoring what is lost.

I usually take my glucometers with me when I go for the lab work. I then test the same blood which drawn for the test to calibrate my meters!
This is a great idea.
You mean venous blood was used in both lab test and glucometer.
Yes!
But glucometers are actually designed only for capillary blood.

That‚Äôs not correct. They are designed to test sugar. When you calibrate the glucometer with a test solution, that‚Äôs not a capillary blood, it‚Äôs a sugar solution of a known concentration.

The glucometer only analyzes the sugar, it cannot differentiate whether it‚Äôs capillary blood or venous blood 

Similarly you can calibrate your meter with venous blood and compare it‚Äôs accuracy with lab report.

messages.text: Are you a vegetarian or non vegetarian

We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet.

messages.text:
T2 diabetics need to keep this in mind:
If they continue with "uncontrolled" blood sugars. As patients progress with type 2 diabetes, they approach the insulin-deficient end of this disease until they reach the stage of being absolutely endogenous insulin deficient, meaning that they can no longer make enough of their own insulin.  Put another way:
The T2 diabetic has now completely destroyed all of their beta-cell mass, now, they're just like a T1 diabetic. They will need to inject basal(background) insulin, they will need to inject bolus(meal time) insulin.
TAKE CARE OF YOUR PANCREAS, DON‚ÄôT STRESS IT, DON‚ÄôT ABUSE IT!

Today I was able to go into absolute thoughtlessness state of mind for little more than a minute . In that minute I thought of nothing .

One thing that is clear is most of the things in life is not linear. 

You can be poor and become rich quickly without following a linear path. 

You can know nothing about a topic and study it an become an expert fairly quickly without following a linear path. 

You can be unfit but become fit fairly quickly without following a linear path.

In such cases only three things matters.

Absolute commitment to the path without any expectations of results and timelines

Relentless practice, almost monomaniacal  

Avoid places where the crowd goes , online and offline and avoid everything that the crowd does.

Sir what is the impact of IF on sugar level of people without diabetes ? Will sugar level go below nomal ? What are the benefits of IF on people without diabetes ? Is there any range for age for doing IF ? ( Lower limit, upper limit )
True TimüòÅüëç

Intermittent fasting has many benefits even for people with diabetes. Lower cholesterol, improve glucose control, reduce liver fat and improve blood pressure. Almost everyone I know have increased endurance, better motor coordination & memory , improved sleep, better cognition and mental powers, increased will power.

Its also clinically proven to increase immunity( 3+ days extended fast) .

The 2016 nobel prize was on reversing aging via Autophagy where the dead cells are cleaned up.
The above benefits are for people with and without diabetes.
Children are advised not to fast, all other age groups are fine.
üôèüèª

Folks who are consuming Chyawanprash of any brand or variety please stop taking them . 

The amount of sugar in them will do more damage to your immunity ( by spiking sugar levels) than increase your immunity via the ingredients in it . This applies for the sugar free variety as well as they are loaded with sweet potatoes and jaggery. 

If you need immunity then take the ingredients in whole form individually. Like Amla, Triphala, Giloy, Haritaki, Ashwagandha 

Chyawanprash is processed food. Avoid them. 


The best immunity herbs are moringa( drumsticks) , lemon, ginger , turmeric . If you are having these it should be more than enough for your daily needs .

Moringa has 7 times more vitamin C than Oranges. 

Lemon has 53mg of Vitamin C in 100gms and the majority of it is in the peel which you can soak in water and have it.

Have whole foods . The market is seemingly flooded with products claiming immunity boosting benefits . 

Also vitamin D , get enough of it by stepping out in the sun. 

If you can‚Äôt go out, go to the terrace of your apartment. It‚Äôs usually empty.

For folks who are planning to wake up earlier than usual here are some tips . 

Divide the time in 30 min slots , 1.5 hours before sunrise.  Now devote each of the 30 mins this way

First 30 mins sit for meditation or prayers or any holy rituals

Second 30 mins workout or do yoga

Third 30 mins whatever skill makes you money. If you an engineer , doctor , lawyer , banker study the latest skill in your field . If you get too absorbed don‚Äôt stop , keep going till everyone in family wakes up . 

This way you will hit the 3 most important goals of mental health, physical health and financial health. 

You will be unstoppable .

The 1.5hrs leading into your local sunrise time is called the Brahma muhurt or the golden hour 

Try the above and see the positive changes in your life starting within a week.

Living without a fan can be cooler than living in AC. Yes Mumbaikars!

Sleeping on floor can be more comfortable than expensive mattresses.

Taste , comfort these are not dependent on the external than your relationship with you own senses.
üëç

Here is a simple example. Eat chilis and you will feel hot even in AC. Its not the heat from outside but the one inside your body that is making you feel hot. Similarly all deep seated anger and discontent inside us is that makes us feel hot. When you can tame that even the heat of desert will not affect you.
Right sir it's all in mind
Like all people today are mad behind calcium protein supplements without knowing it's effect usage only thing is that they hv to take is what they know

The reason for sharing this interview was not to promote psychedelics. Infact psychedelics are the poorest way to cope with the issues mentioned in the interview.

The real reason of sharing the above is I found the interview a very honest confession that hacks dont work... from a biohacker and arguably worlds most read motivational guru that is famous for teaching tips and tricks.

The only place hacks work is for the authors selling these books which gives its readers mini dopamine hits in making them believe that succeeding is matter of building habits off a checklist they are selling you and if you buy their book and subscribe to their newsletter you will succeed. 

Hacks dont work for the simple reason that you are smarter than that and your mind will soon catch up to the trick. The only thing that works is working lifelong on your own 'core' issues which mostly stem for improper childhood.
Nevertheless here are some gold nuggets from the interview.

text.text: "most of us say we want to be healed or we want to change, but that, in fact, is not true. What we want is a reprieve. What we want is a salve to remove pain. But there's a big difference between looking for a reprieve and looking for a solution. The solution involves focusing on things that can be very uncomfortable

"You can‚Äôt deepen relationships, repair relationships, deescalate instead of escalate conflict, unless you have a certain degree of self-awareness, emotional resilience, and emotional acceptance. That only comes, in my experience, through transcendental, transformative blocks of time touching the timeless, in a sense. Where the ego is dissolved."

"‚ÄòThere's really only one question worth considering and that is: What are you unwilling to feel?‚Äô‚Äù So I really check in, in the morning and at night. Do you wake up with a sense of foreboding and anxiety and a desire to stay in bed? When you go to bed, is it full of anxiety and worries and preoccupation about what happened, or what's going to happen the next day? If so, that's an issue."

A child that grew up in an environment where one or both parents were missing emotionally will always want to seek their approval and will grow up to have poor self esteem and confidence. 

When that child becomes an adult they will always seek relationships where external validation will matter more than love and respect. Their sense of identity , self worth will be tied to their partner‚Äôs validation that will often keep them stuck in abusive relationships.

They will seek jobs where they will work for very little appreciation because whatever little they receive will mirror the lack of appreciation during their upbringing and they will seek comfort in that , because that‚Äôs the only kind of comfort they are familiar with. As a result their whole lives they will go from one dysfunctional relationship and unstable job to another never content ,never happy. They for a whole life believe that more fame, more money, a better partner, a better job is the way to happiness.

The only way to true happiness is self awareness. This can be as simple as sitting for meditation or seeking lifelong psychotherapeutic help. These habits might take sometime to show initial results but they quickly compound and help you build a better foundation for you.

text:
Folks, have been talking to some people who want to gain weight as they are now underweight. 

By talking to them it seems they might have mild to major depression which is a leading cause of weight loss. This can be attributed to the pandemic situation or other events. 

We cannot self diagnose Depression but all of you can use this Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD) online and see your scores. Its fairly accurate.

If the results show depression then please consult a psychotherapist at your earliest convenience. Many are offering online consultations. Often improvement can be seen in a week or two. So please dont suffer in silence.

1. Whom did you cheat?

2. What did you achieve by having a cheat meal?

3. Was it worth?

Just believe in yourself, you can do it. Tomorrow is a new day, start afresh!

text.text:
We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

would recommend the following test to confirm diabetes or pre diabetes

1.  Fasting C-Peptide

2. Fasting Insulin 

3. Fasting blood sugar

4. One hour insulin response to a high carb meal

5. HbA1c 

6. Liver panel test

7. Lipid profile (ALT, AST, GGT included) This may be covered under Comprehensive Metabolic Panel Test but I‚Äôm not sure about India.

8. Comprehensive Metabolic Panel

9. HS CRP

10. TSH + Free T4

11. Vitamin D, 25-OH

12. Vitamin B 12

13. Check your BMI

What you are describing is a form of mindfulness meditation where one observes the thoughts as they come and go , staying perfectly detached . 

The one I am practicing, there are no thoughts 

I start by first calming my mind using anapana ( breathing technique ) 

Then I reduce thoughts in mind using Vipassana ( body scan)

Then I scan my mind for any new thoughts and start clearing them away as soon as they form. In sometime all thoughts cease . This I was able to to for 5 secs few weeks ago and now I can go upto 5 mins . 

In crutchless form I use a stopwatch to calculate duration. I have been able to go upto a minute 

When using a crutch I count seconds when I am scanning my mind . I can do this upto 5 mins now .

text:
Should the "Asian " community including Indians start eating healthy only in response to becoming overweight or getting some disease diagnosis? Or should we eat healthy even if we are "normal BMI"? Let's see.

The "Screen At 23" guideline started in 2015 when ADA (American Diabetes Association) recognized that for Asian Americans, the BMI threshold for testing for diabetes should be lowered from 25 to 23. This is because a large %age of Asian Americans with "normal BMI" (in range 18.5 to 24.9) actually have diabetes -- it remains undiagnosed.

Fruit can be consumed in Low Fat Vegan(LFV) Diet and only Blackberries, Blueberries, and Coconut are allowed in Low Carb High Fat(LCHF) Diet.

Some Fruits depending on glycemic index (GI) levels can cause massive spike in sugar levels. Members on LFV diet are advised to exercise caution in consuming them in limited quantities

1. Morning BF -  Salad(cucumber, tomato, onion, carrot) + Sprouted moong dal,  2-3 cloves of garlic, two spoons sprouted fenugreek and mix it with chat masala + haldi + pepper powder

2.  Lunch Total Brown rice with some curry and dal.

Folks, a lot of you wanted a diet chart. Now you can print your diet chart automatically. 

When you enter your and family medical history along with current diet our automated dietitian will select your diet items divided by breakfast, lunch, snack and dinner.

messages.text: Not getting reversal point. Do not We have to follow strict diet throughout the life?

Well this is not a diet, its lifestyle. Reversal or remission does not mean that one can go back to old eating habits which caused the metabolic imbalance. Its like getting treated for a drug addiction and then getting back to drugs.
Reversal can be decided by many factors, one of them being normal blood sugar both in fasted and as well as after a meal
Congratulations Tim, Mrudula, Sangeetha üéâ

Though Whole grains like brown rice, oats and millets are green light food on this lifestyle, the body does not react well to them during the initial phase of reversal. That is why we recommend a slow introduction of Whole Grains once the reversal point is reached which normally 3-6 months based on stabilized blood sugar and normal HbA1c and other parameters. Roti and Dal are still in grey areas as they are highly processed food and one must eat them in moderation after reversal point.

We are highly addicted to roti and rice. We normally consume more rice and roti than vegetables and salad. When I was on LFV diet (after I had reversed my diabetes HbA1c 5.4-.5.6), I followed the following guidelines whenever I had roti or rice- 

1. For each roti or 1/2 cup brown rice, eat a big bowl of salad and big bowl of sabzi (oil less). 

2. If  you want to have the second roti or second serving of 1/2 cup rice, again eat and big bowl of salad and big bowl of sabzi. 

Repeat it for every additional roti or addition serving of rice.

I always used a  half and half mixture of whole flour and vegetables like spinach, cauliflower, beets to make rotis

Yes right sir. But if this lifestyle going to give everyone complications free and healthy life. Then no need to jump on previous diet. You are right sir mostly I and family is addicted to traditional diet.
This is what addiction is

Most of the Indians are classified as TOFI, thin outside and fat inside. We have a strong tendency to accumulate visceral fat(fat around organs like liver, kidneys, pancreas, heart) rather than subcutaneous fat ( fat below the skin). It‚Äôs the visceral fat which is responsible for diabetes, insulin resistance and elevated blood sugar levels
What's the remedy
Lose the visceral fat!
Avoid processed food
Intermittent fasting is best practice to lose the visceral fat
There are scans which will inform us about the amount of visceral fat.

Saw in one group where a person was discussing her glucometer reading show consistently 30pts more in right hand compared to left
What could be the reason

1. She has poor circulation of blood sugar in one hand vs other. Hence squeezing one hand more than other.if you have to squeeze too hard, you could be measuring interstitial fluid instead of blood.

2. One hand is not clean.

3.Blood glucose levels vary from minute to minute, and from body part to body part. It is not unusual to see a difference of plus or minus 15 to 20 percent from one reading to another, and this is generally considered the industry standard for blood glucose meters. 

4. faulty meter.



All the above affect sugar levels
Ok
The fluctuations levels are higher if the blood sugar is high. For a normal non diabetic person the fluctuations will be lower.

messages.text: is prolonged fasting for a couple of days ok??? a genuine query after reading‚òùÔ∏è

Diabetes can be due to many other issues and many times is a combination

1. High systemic Inflammation( elevated CrP marker)
2. Thyroid
3. Beta cell loss
4.Gestational diabetes or giving birth to a baby weighing more than 9 pounds.

The above list is not comprehensive.
Prolonged fasts often 14 day fasts are the best therapy for Type 2 diabetes.

Gluconeogenesis occurs when body utilizes non carbohydrate sources for glucose formation. Hence we advise not to go on High Protein low Carb diet. In absence of any food in fasting Ketosis occurs. Gluconeogenesis doesn't occur from muscle tissue. 

One of the main reason people lose muscle is because they dont do resistance training. When there is sufficient activation of muscle ,fasting does not cause muscle loss.

text.text:
Keto idli #
Take 100 gms of paneer with 3 tblspn of  coconut flour +2 tblspn of physillum husk+2 tsp of hung curd+salt.+ 1/2 tsp of baking powder.

Many health issues disappear when we reduce the excess heat produced in the body. Two most effective ways are.

1. Sleeping on the floor. It acts as a heat sink and drains the body of excess heat . When we sleep on mattress the opposite occurs. It acts as a heat trap , keeping the body hot and restless.

2. Cold showers. They lower the body temperature and preserve the vital organs.

messages.text: working lunch

Since April 2020, I am strictly following 16:8 intermittent fasting. 

Last diet in the night was at 9 pm and first meal during noon was at 1.30pm.

My weight came down from 78 kg to 69kg. Current BMI is 23.3. My age is 39 yr

But my sugar level always ranges between 90-115 just before first meal. Where as PP measures 135-145. 

My current medicines is Amaryl M2 (two times a day).

Last HbA1C was 6.1 on 8th Jun 2020.

Would I be able to bring my HbA1C to 5.8 by 15th Sept ?

Today I would like to share my meditation and sleep experience with you guys. Since the last month, I woke up at around 3 a.m and start meditating. It benefits me in my polyphasic sleep. I slept on exercise mat at 12 am and woke up at 3 am. and again I slept on bed at around 7 am and woke up around 10 am. And felt like both the sleep is deep. I have also tried to sleep on a bed for 2 days but felt laziness so again started to sleep on exercise mat.  Mostly I prefer to sleep in 1 h:30 min cycle. Means If I woke up after 1 h:30 min or 3 h or 6 h sleep then feel vary energetic.

First of all congratulations on bringing your sugar levels down. Your HbA1C is in non diabetes range.  Based on our data you should be able to achieve HbA1C 5.8 by Sept if you continue fasting. However focus on the process and dont chase numbers.

At this point more HbA1C you should be tracking your Insulin Resistance via the C-Peptide Test. True test of reversal will be a healthy C-Peptide result.

All the best !

Wow Margi! Mastering Polyphasic sleep is one of the hardest things to do. I have been trying for months now üòÅ. 


Now you are in the league of Edison, Tesla, Einstein, Churchill, Leonardo Da Vinci who all attributed their success to polyphasic sleep!

When are you teaching me?
Thank you Tim‚ò∫Ô∏è

One of the greatest misconceptions of our times is we need 8 hours of sleep. 

What the body needs is sufficient rest. The more the mind is rested the less sleep it needs. Hence sleeping well and sleeping deep should be the focus areas , not lying in bed for 8 hours trying to sleep. 

Like everything else in life, Quality matters more than quantity here.

Meditation is the best way to rest the body and mind. Thats why people who meditate regularly need so little sleep. 

Its also why after 15 mins of deep meditation we feel more fresh than 8 hours of bed.

Exogenous insulin is equally harmful if it is not an absolute necessity for the body. Hyperinsulinemia is very detrimental for human body. Type 2 diabetics have a high state of insulin and exogenous insulin elevate the amount of insulin further.

Excess of exogenous insulin is also not good for Type 1 diabetic as the body starts developing insulin resistance. Once Type 1 diabetic develops insulin resistance they become Type 1 and Type 2 simultaneously. This stage is very critical and bad for Type 1 diabetic. Maintaining and improving insulin sensitivity is key not only for Type 2 diabetics but also Type 1 diabetics.

In 2017 I was flying on a New York to Mumbai Air India flight to launch my startup Diabetely( earlier name of Eradicate Diabetes ). 

I happened to meet a very senior retired endocrinologist who was the ex-chairman of RSSDI (RESEARCH SOCIETY FOR THE STUDY OF DIABETES IN INDIA ). It was a 14 hour flight and we spoke for the majority of it and barely slept. 

One of the topics of discussion was Insulin vs Oral drugs. Many doctors prefer early intervention of insulin vs oral drugs because they consider it as the most natural replacement of the insulin our bodies produce. 

He admitted the comparison is flawed and the results are mixed. While some patients do recover from Insulin Resistance , others go on to develop early dependence on insulin which could have been avoided if they had started with the oral route. 

Furthermore there are titration complications. Our bodies produce insulin in the amount required but most people administer a fixed dosage often leading to injecting more than needed. This leads to hypoglycemia, which can cause falls and even death. Most modern oral drugs dont have Hypoglycemia issue. 

He concluded that titration issue and early dependance on insulin are the two major reasons why Oral drugs are still preferred over insulin in early stages. 

Since then I have met 2 other ex RSSDI chairmen and they have mentioned similar points.
üëç
üëç

Consumption of oils among Indian population
‚Ä¢ In the rural South Indian population from the CURES
study, highest intake of fats directly correlated with risk of
abdominal obesity (p<0.001), hypertension (p=0.04), and
impaired fasting glucose (p=0.01). In particular, sunflower
oil was found to be most detrimental when compared to
traditional oils and palmolein.[131]
‚Ä¢ Supporting this finding, the risk of metabolic syndrome
was higher among users of sunflower oil (30.7%) versus
palmolein (23.2%) or traditional (groundnut or sesame)
oil (17.1%, p<0.001) in Asian Indians. Higher percentage
of linoleic acid PUFA in sunflower oil was correlated
with the risk of metabolic syndrome.[132] The observations
from these studies are preliminary and should be further
investigated.
‚Ä¢ Managing dietary intervention by replacing refined
cooking oils with those containing high percentage of
MUFA (canola and olive oil) in Asian Indians with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease was associated with significant
reduction in body weight and BMI (p<0.01, olive oil),
improvements in fasting insulin level and homeostasis
model of assessment for insulin resistance and Œ≤-cell
function (p<0.001, olive oil), increase in high-density
lipoprotein level (p=0.004, olive oil), and decrease in
fasting blood glucose (p=0.03) and triglyceride (p=0.02)
level (in canola group).[133]
S12 Int J Diabetes Dev Ctries (Jan-March 2020) 40 (Supp l):S1-S122
Chawla, et al.: RSSDI-ESI clinical practice recommendations
‚Ä¢ Increasing use of saturated fat, low intake of n-3 PUFAs,
and increase in TFAs was observed among India patients
with T2DM and obesity and it is recommended that
improving quality of fats in diet (more MUFAs and omega
3 PUFAs) would be beneficial in T2DM.[134,135]
‚Ä¢ Repeated heating/frying or reusing of oils at high
temperature, which is a common practice in India should
be avoided as it, induces chemical changes that increases
the amounts of harmful TFAs, which greatly elevate the
risk of CV complications in T2DM patients.[136,137]

Tim sir, when pancreas is in good condition not overworking or underworking then what is the causes that blood glucose goes up.
Pls edify
In normal BMI person

The most critical factor is the visceral fat, that is the fat around the organs (liver and kidney) and also the fat stored in the muscles. Liver and muscles are the key places where body stores sugar as glycogen, when there is excess energy is in the body, the body store that energy as visceral fat as well as in the muscles. These fat makes liver as well as muscles insulin resistant. Muscles and liver refuse to accept the sugar from the blood leading to elevated levels of blood sugar. 

Insulin also suppresses a key hormone secreted by pancreas, which sends signal to liver to release additional sugar into blood. Due to the visceral fat around pancreas, the pancreas also becomes insulin resistant which leads to elevated level of glucagon. This elevated levels of glucagon then signals the liver to release additional sugar into blood. 

It‚Äôs a viscous cycle. Due to insulin resistance not only the food we eat raises the blood sugar but the body also continues to release additional  sugar into the blood.

BMI is misleading especially for Indians because even at a normal BMI most of the Indian are either pre diabetic or diabetic.

We are referred to as TOFI, thin out side and Fat Inside. Even with a normal BMI, Indians have lot of visceral fat.

If a diabetic person consistently follows the intermittent fasting to be more healthy with controlled BMI and sugar reading. 

 a person lost weight around 20-30 kg in 6 months by doing IF.

The question is 

If doing same thing for ever in life , shall  that person will keep on losing weight or there is some threshold weight from where mass of the body will remain constant.

I lost weight around 18 kg in last 4 months from 86kg to 68kg. 

I dont want to lose more weight as I am now become fat less body but not thin body. 

Till when I should be doing the IF for weight loss? 

Now I should look for muscles gain to maintain my body weight
I want to reduce my blood sugar and weight how to start.

No a person will not lose weight on IF beyond a certain point. 

If you dont want to lose further weight, you can start weight training with slightly increase protein intake. This will preserve muscle mass .

We tend to forget that there is a lot of fat in the body that is not visible. This fat is all around the organs and causes them to fail. This is also the primary reason for Insulin Resistance. 

Please see the below image to get an idea of how much fat is around organs( visceral) vs visible( subcutaneous).

During IF the visceral fat which is in higher proportion than subcutaneous fat  is also burning causing the weight loss. Hence although the person looks thin/slim/toned from outside there is a lot of fat burning that still needs to happen for the organs to function well.

Few Key points to implement to reverse diabetes and help maintain normal blood sugar

1. No snacking at all. Snacking and multiple meals are the main causative factors that lead to diabetes.

2. If you are on LCHF diet, no more than two meals a day. Don‚Äôt eat anything after 6 pm.

3. If you are on LFV diet, no more than 3 meals a day. Don‚Äôt eat anything after 6 pm.

4. Please check your your blood sugar 4-5 times a day. This includes fasting blood sugar, after meals, before going to bed and one random time check

5. Please understand your diet plan very clearly and don‚Äôt eat anything which is not allowed on your diet. 
For instance, no grains, and fruits on LCHF diet

And
Absolutely no oil and animal products on LFV diet

6. Limit the consumption of nuts on both diets.

7. Exercise and IF are very critical for keeping the diabetes in remission along with the diet

8. Eat Whole Food, avoid all processed food and artificial sweeteners.

9. Don‚Äôt be ignorant, take that extra pain to make sure that your blood sugar stays in normal range. 
Don‚Äôt assume it to be normal if you haven‚Äôt checked your numbers.

10.  We all are different individuals and react differently to different food. So make sure to find out which food works perfect for you and which food spikes your blood sugar. 

11. Don‚Äôt assume anything, ask questions!

The ideal body weight can be measured as 

Ideal Weight (in kg)=(body height in cm - 100)* 0.9

E.g. 
Ideal weight = (172 - 100) * 0.9
 = 72*0.9 = 64.8 kg.

messages.text: This is how your body reacts by producing insulin if you eat carbohydrates/sugar, protein and fat. The body has to release more insulin if you eat carbs/sugar, moderately less insulin if you eat protein and very less if you eat fat.

Normally we don't eat just carbs/sugar, protein or fat. Our meal is composed of a mixture of all these, hence the insulin spike would be much higher which means the pancreas has to work harder to maintain the demand. Eventually the pancreas fail to produce sufficient insulin and then we may have to go for external insulin

Following is are my recommendations

4. You can still monitor your 1 h and 2 h PP

messages.text: Good Morning Tim
Good evening Raj!
Just wondering.. why not smoothie

It‚Äôs body‚Äôs job to break down, digest and absorb the nutrition from the food.  When you have a smoothie, you have already processed the food and done 75% of body‚Äôs job. This processing of food will lead to a rapid rise in blood sugar. 

Just imagine eating a banana bite by bite, the body gets ample time to digest it and absorb the sugar. 

Second instance just make a smoothie of the banana and drink it. This does not need any processing by the body and hence will cause a rapid spike in blood sugar.

Imagine you are anticipating some guest at home, accordingly you start preparing to welcome them. You clean your house, make arrangements for food etc. 

Just imagine instead of arriving at 2 pm, the guest come in at 11 am! How would you react? It will be lot of chaos and panic. 

It‚Äôs the same way for body. There is process involved in anticipation of incoming food, sending signals to produce and release enzymes, hormones to process the food. But suddenly the body gets everything processed and it is not prepared to face it.  what happens? There is a sudden spike in blood sugar for which body is not prepared and it takes time for the body to react and make things normal!

Unfortunately, we have been abusing our body with all the processed craps in the name pleasure and satisfaction. 

The result is obesity and diabetes!
üëç

O my god ... Eye opening  üëÄ information ...I was so addicted to Pizzas earlier ... but now after I started fasting in my mind I am able   to tell myself no that is totally not good for me I have to avoid such food to keep body clean üòÑ

And many more food items automatically I am able to resist after I started fasting and say myself hey how about not touching this food is junk for my body ... Fasting is working amazing in its own away üòÑüòÄ
üëç
Self awareness and discipline is key for a healthy life.

Fasting acts a a natural filter . When we fast regularly eating junk food makes us sick. The body during fasting gets to know which foods are good for us and which are not.

That‚Äôs why when people struggle to follow a diet plan we ask them to fast . They find it much easier to adhere to diets when they fast
üëç Well explained. When you practice fasting, if you don't reject a junk food...the body will reject it!

Hooray! papaya can be consumed in both Low Fat Vegan diet & Low Carb High Fat diet.  On a Low Carb High Fat diet you can have all vegetables except root Vegetables that grow under the ground. These are restricted: Yams, beets, parsnips, turnips, rutabagas, carrots, yuca, kohlrabi, celery root, horseradish, daikon, jicama, radishes. Pumpkin and Squash are also restricted
Onion, Garlic ,Turmeric, Ginger are used as spices and to be used in limited quantities

chocolate for is allowed in the Low Carb High Fat(LCHF) diet only . They are not allowed in Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet.

Potatoes are Whole Food, can be eaten by diabetics in low fat vegan diet!

A Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet focuses on whole plant foods, such as fruits, starchy vegetables like sweet potatoes, pulses, whole grains. vegetables, and eliminates animal foods like meats and dairy and eggs and processed foods, including refined oils, sugars, and grains. 

Fruits are the best thing one can eat on LFV diet. The spikes due to fruits comes down faster. The spikes from starches are much higher than fruits and takes longer to come down. Please don‚Äôt be scared. It‚Äôs very natural. 

Remember anything you eat on LFV diet will spike your blood sugar. I would encourage you to do the following:
1. For a month just check your fasting blood sugar
2. Eat fruits with some green, like spinach. Start with spinach.
3. Try to maintain at least 3 hours gap between each meal, no snacking.
4. Don‚Äôt eat after 6 pm. 
5. Go for a  brisk walk or do stair climbing one hour after each meal.

Perseverance and commitment is key to succeed on LFV because the spikes will really scare you. But if you are intimidated by the spikes just check your fasting sugar. It will take time for the body to readjust. LFV is a very slow process in terms of visible results, so please have patience.

Potatoes are not allowed in Low carb High Fat because of the high fat content of the diet

LCHF is a general way of eating that involves consuming foods that are generally low-carb and high-fat. The ketogenic diet is a form of LCHF diet and a metabolic state that switches your body from burning glucose as fuel to burning fat as fuel. Both diets are clinically proven to reverse diabetes, hypertension, help loose fat and improve heart health.
The major issue with diabetics are are that they can not use carbs and fats simultaneously for energy. Hence one diet is high in carb (LFV) and other is high in fat (LCHF)
Another doubt I have is, diabetes means layer of FAT has formed in the organs especially pancreas. So, if we take more FAT, how will this condition get reversed?
Oh ok. I used to think we have to reduce both Fat and carbs at the same time.
When you eat High Fat, you are turning your body into a fat burner. It starts using fat as energy.
Ok...didn't know about this concept
On a high fat diet, you are not consuming carbs as major source of energy. You are training your body to burn fat and it gets fat adapted

In a fasted state the body is in fat burning mode, it will not burn muscle or protein. Muscle is used by the body only during the starvation period not fasting period. The body needs protein after the work up to build up the muscle
A pre workout meal puts body under lots of stress. Stress of exercise and stress of digestion!
Sir What is primary source of burning during workout it's carb or fat in the body?
It all depends upon the type of exercise
Higher intensity work out requires rapid energy hence carbs will be used, and for low intensity work out fat is generally used

On a LCHF diet, the blood sugar never goes to zero. Why? The body maintains the optimal sugar level by making its own sugar in the liver. Its a demand driven process.

text.text:
We in this group follow two types of diet and many of our members have successfully reversed their diabetes and have gone off medications 

The first diet is low fat vegan diet (LFV) . On this diet avoid all dairy products, animal products, oil, and ghee. Also avoid all processed carbohydrates like roti, rice, biscuits, rusks, sugar, etc

The second diet is Low Carb High Fat (LCHF). One can eat all the vegetables (except potatoes, sweet potatoes, beetroots) cooked in ghee, butter or olive oil, nonveg, cream, and nuts. No roti, rice, biscuits or sugar on this diet. 

Would you be able to follow any of the above diets?

Actually almost all recipes can be made without oil . 

Instead of frying Masala in oil you can do one of the following 

1.  Dry roast the spices whole. The smell and taste of the curry is better this way 

2. Fry the whole or powdered spices with chopped tomatoes

3. Add powdered spices without frying

.


In most cases you will never notice the difference  and in some cases the taste and smell will be better than using oil .

That‚Äôs very less water . We suggest 3 -4 liters water in a 16 hr fasting window. 

When is your 42 hour fast coming to an end?
Morning 8.40
What you will need to be careful about is Refeeding Syndrome . It‚Äôs extremely rare and with proper protocol followed during breaking the fast it can be avoided .
What's the best way to break the long fast

1. Start having some salt in water. A spoon a day is enough .

2. Break your fast with cucumber . 

3. Have above the ground veggies for the first 12 hours of breaking the fast
All the best

Above the ground. Means no root veggies like potatoes , yam, beets etc
These guidelines are for people breaking fast longer than 72 hours and even then refeeding syndrome is extremely rare

messages.text: This is my insulin level and c-peptide
Hi @raj how is the progress?
What were the previous levels? Did you also got your fasting blood sugar sugar done along with fasting c-peptide
Fbs is 100 and I have done c-peptide and insulin level for the first time.
Was the fasting blood sugar done at the same time with the fasting c-peptide?
Yes
C-peptide looks good to me. üëç
What about insulin level ,usually what it indicates
Normally insulin levels fluctuates that‚Äôs why c-peptide is a better marker of pancreas function!
Still better marker would be the c-peptide and blood sugar test 1 hour and 2-hour post meal. If the c-peptide levels don‚Äôt elevate then there is a loss of pancreatic beta cell.
Ok thanks ‚ù§Ô∏è
So 1.2 is safe right
Yes!

text.text: Still better marker would be the c-peptide and blood sugar test 1 hour and 2-hour post meal. If the c-peptide levels don‚Äôt elevate then there is a loss of pancreatic beta cell.

messages.text: My this time post meal 2hrs was 90
I didn't take 1hr
Lab tested
Pancreatic beta cell loss means??
Next time test your post meal c-peptide also.
What could be the complication??
Ok

The beta cell of pancreas makes pro-insulin which is c-peptide plus insulin. After release the pro insulin breaks into c-peptide and insulin. Insulin is very short lived, that is why we measure c-peptide to assess the function of pancreatic beta cell

The real test of pancreas happens after a meal, when it has to release sufficient insulin to lower the blood sugar. If the c-peptide does not increase after a meal, it is an indication of loss of beta cells which makes insulin.
Oh ok
So how do we increase??
So my reading is not good?? I am confused
Unfortunately nothing much can be done about it. They can‚Äôt be restored to be 100%.
Oh
We need to check the post meal c-peptide levels
Ok
Will check
Fasting c-peptides levels is good.
Ok

messages.text:
Chicken can be consumed in Low Carb High Fat(LCHF) diet and not allowed in Low Fat Vegan(LFV) diet.

We ask our members to restrict protein to <20% of your total calorie requirements.. Excess protein may get converted into sugar by liver by a process called gluconeogenesis.
